  • TAKE CARE OF YOUR EYES - THEY HAVE TO LAST YOUR ENTIRE LIFE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/lifestyle/health/the-doctor-says/2022/10/11/take-care-of-your-eyes---they-have-to-last-your-entire-life

    10/11/2022, 09:04

    82.81% Shortened!

    Eye conditions are common and can be acute or chronic

    Many adults will have experienced an eye condition in their lives

    Some eye conditions do not typically cause vision impairment, but others do

    The common eye conditions that do not typically cause vision impairment include eyelid inflammation, conjunctivitis, dry eye, cyst or stye, benign growth and subconjunctival haemorrhage

    Malaysia has a National Eye Register, with the last report published in 2016

    Improving eye care The World Health Organization’s (WHO) 2019 World Report on Vision provided evidence of the magnitude of eye conditions and vision impairment globally

    It also focused on effective strategies that address eye care and recommended actions to improve eye care services

    Vision impairment has an enormous global financial burden

    The intention was to increase global eye care coverage, and to strengthen the quality of the eye care services delivered

    Check the expiry date on eye makeup and replace your brushes regularly to prevent the build-up of bacteria that could cause eye infections

    An eye test can detect an eye condition even before it’s affected your eyesight, so even if you don’t think there’s anything wrong with your eyes, you should book a test to check them

    ['eye', 'condition', 'vision', 'impairment', 'age']

    Eye conditions are common and can be acute or chronic

    Many adults will have experienced an eye condition in their lives

    Some eye conditions do not typically cause vision impairment, but others do

    The common eye conditions that do not typically cause vision impairment include eyelid inflammation, conjunctivitis, dry eye, cyst or stye, benign growth and subconjunctival haemorrhage

    Malaysia has a National Eye Register, with the last report published in 2016

    Improving eye care The World Health Organization’s (WHO) 2019 World Report on Vision provided evidence of the magnitude of eye conditions and vision impairment globally

    It also focused on effective strategies that address eye care and recommended actions to improve eye care services

    Vision impairment has an enormous global financial burden

    The intention was to increase global eye care coverage, and to strengthen the quality of the eye care services delivered

    Check the expiry date on eye makeup and replace your brushes regularly to prevent the build-up of bacteria that could cause eye infections

    An eye test can detect an eye condition even before it’s affected your eyesight, so even if you don’t think there’s anything wrong with your eyes, you should book a test to check them

    ['eye', 'condition', 'vision', 'impairment', 'age']



  • TRIPLETS ON THEIR WAY TO BECOMING EDUCATORS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/11/triplets-on-their-way-to-becoming-educators

    10/11/2022, 08:35

    60.71% Shortened!

    The brothers from Bayan Baru, Penang, have been offered places to pursue their Bachelor of Social Science degree at Universiti Sains Malaysia – a stone’s throw from their home

    However, the three brothers – two of whom are identical – want to enjoy the campus experience as they have been offered places in the hostel

    In fact, they say they would only go home for the weekends

    “This way, we get to have the best of both worlds,” said Mohamed Azwan

    Our goal is to become educators, one way or another

    Mohamed Azwan said he would probably major in something to do with sports, as he hopes to become a coach some day

    Mohamed Azmin, on the other hand, would like to become a maths teacher, while Mohamed Azrul has set his mind on becoming a lecturer

    Mohamed Azmin and Mohamed Azwan are identical, while Mohamed Azrul is shorter and has distinctly different features

    “In the past, when teachers mistook us, we just played along as we did not want to cause further confusion,” said Mohamed Azmin

    “We are used to people asking us about being triplets and what it is like,” said Mohamed Azmin.

    Bachelor of Social Science

    ['triplet', 'mohamed', 'azmin', 'azwan', 'three']

    The brothers from Bayan Baru, Penang, have been offered places to pursue their Bachelor of Social Science degree at Universiti Sains Malaysia – a stone’s throw from their home

    However, the three brothers – two of whom are identical – want to enjoy the campus experience as they have been offered places in the hostel

    In fact, they say they would only go home for the weekends

    “This way, we get to have the best of both worlds,” said Mohamed Azwan

    Our goal is to become educators, one way or another

    Mohamed Azwan said he would probably major in something to do with sports, as he hopes to become a coach some day

    Mohamed Azmin, on the other hand, would like to become a maths teacher, while Mohamed Azrul has set his mind on becoming a lecturer

    Mohamed Azmin and Mohamed Azwan are identical, while Mohamed Azrul is shorter and has distinctly different features

    “In the past, when teachers mistook us, we just played along as we did not want to cause further confusion,” said Mohamed Azmin

    “We are used to people asking us about being triplets and what it is like,” said Mohamed Azmin.

    Bachelor of Social Science

    ['triplet', 'mohamed', 'azmin', 'azwan', 'three']



  • ARSENAL FINALLY FIND THEIR OWN KEVIN DE BRUYNE AS MATT TURNER BRACED FOR PREMIER LEAGUE DEBUT

    https://www.football.london/arsenal-fc/news/arsenal-kevin-de-bruyne-debut-25223477

    10/11/2022, 08:34

    52.17% Shortened!

    Arsenal defeated Liverpool 3-2 in a brilliant encounter at the Emirates to return to the top of the Premier League and football.london takes a look at some of the viral moments from the match Sign up to the free Arsenal newsletter so you don't miss the latest Gunners news, straight to your inbox We have more newsletters Just when you believe things couldn’t get much better for Arsenal, they put in a performance which only raises the expectations even more

    Arsenal went into the game full of confidence thanks to ten wins in eleven matches across all competitions this season, whilst Jurgen Klopp's side found themselves part of Liverpool’s worst start to the league for eight years, now ten after yesterday’s defeat

    Not that long ago, Liverpool were the team to beat after being crowned champions of England and Europe, but now Arsenal are making a push of their own to reach that very level

    However, although those match-ups were both a success for Arsenal, it was Gabriel Martinelli who ultimately stole the show

    Despite having a head start, Diaz was swiftly overtaken by Martinelli, who ended up winning a foul for his side

    Considering Diaz is easily one of the quickest players in the league, it was some sprint from Martinelli

    Saka found the Norwegian just outside the 18-yard box, who then spotted Martinelli making a run in behind the Liverpool backline

    “The way he put the ball to Martinelli in the first minute of the game to make the game in our favour was great

    Summer signing Matt Turner came close to making his Premier League debut against Liverpool after Aaron Ramsdale picked up an injury

    The Arsenal No.1 appeared to tweak something when taking a goal kick during the first half, before eventually going to ground and asking for medical assistance

    However, after taking a closer look at the injury, it was decided that Ramsdale could stay on and he didn’t appear to encounter any further problems during the match

    ['arsenal', 'liverpool', 'match', 'game', 'make']

  • RIO FERDINAND SAYS IT'S 'CONCERNING' THAT SANCHO IS INCAPABLE OF REPLICATING HIS BUNDESLIGA FORM

    https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-11301187/Rio-Ferdinand-says-concerning-Sancho-incapable-replicating-Bundesliga-form.html

    10/11/2022, 08:05

    62.07% Shortened!

    'If I'm Jadon Sancho, or in Jadon Sancho's camp, I am looking at ways in which I can unpick his game, his mind, to unearth the Sancho that made him a coveted talent around Europe

    'But I just want to see the Sancho that I was going crazy about and demanding that he come on during the Euros, because I haven't seen that.' It's been just over a year since he arrived at Old Trafford

    He had been courted by Ole Gunnar Solskjaer for over 12 months before signing to join United.  The England international put pen to paper on a £73million - swapping Borussia Dortmund and the Bundesliga for United and the Premier League

    However, it was in Germany that Sancho became a household name

    During the 2018-2019 season he scored 12 goals and provided 18 assists.  As a result, Sancho was handed his England debut against the United States in November 2018.  Ferdinand says Sancho has shown glimpses of his talent during games like the Liverpool one Playing on the left side, he enjoyed an even more productive 2019-20 season with 17 Bundesliga goals and assists - which is when Manchester United first came calling

    However, United dusted themselves off and moved for Sancho again in the 2021 summer transfer window - securing his services for £73m.  Sancho has since failed to live up to expectations

  • ROY KEANE PICKS JAMIE CARRAGHER, GARY NEVILLE AND GRAEME SOUNESS AS HIS THREE TOP PUNDITS

    https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-11301239/Roy-Keane-picks-Jamie-Carragher-Gary-Neville-Graeme-Souness-three-pundits.html

    10/11/2022, 08:03

    54.17% Shortened!

    Roy Keane was asked to pick his top three of a number of categories on Monday Night Football Perhaps wishing to cause a bit of mischief with his friend Richards, Keane listed Graeme Souness, Carragher and Gary Neville as his top three.  'I have to go with Jamie (Carragher), we have done a deal

    Jamie Carragher took great pleasure in revealing his top three as well as finding out a bit more about Keane 'I like Graeme Souness

    One word can light up the studio, there is no one better than that.  'I would have to say my companion Gary, the detail he goes into, and big Micah Richards

    That is the three I like working with best.' Graeme Souness was selected by Keane partly for his admiration of him as a player in his youth Rather surprisingly, Keane omitted Micah Richards from his list in news that could devastate the Sky Sports pundit Other lists Keane and Carragher were asked to collate included their three favourite Premier League players currently, their top three managers and their favourite films of all time.  Keane listed Kevin De Bruyne, Erling Haaland and Cristiano Ronaldo as his top three current players in the division, while Carragher opted for the first two but switched Virgil van Dijk out for the Portuguese.  The Irishman chose Graham Potter, Thomas Frank and Pep Guardiola as his favourite coaches

    Number three, I'm sure I will get the seal of approval from Roy 'The Commitments',' Carragher said.   'Brilliant choices I have to say

    "One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest' is definitely in my top three, "There Will be Blood" and "Shawshank Redemption"', Keane responded.  Keane selected his former teammates to Wayne Rooney and Ronaldo in his top three favourite players of the Premier League era alongside former foe Thierry Henry.   Roy Keane selected Thierry Henry as one of his favourite Premier League players of the past Both Carragher and Keane selected Kevin De Bruyne and Erling Haaland in their top three current Premier League stars

  • 'EXERCISE YOUR RIGHT TO VOTE'

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/11/exercise-your-right-to-vote

    10/11/2022, 07:35

    56.0% Shortened!

    “This election is important in stabilising the political situation of the country and people should be encouraged to execrise their right to vote, even when faced with the possibility of floods,” the Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia president said after a party meeting in Pahang

    Muhyiddin, who is also Perikatan Nasional chairman, said it had been agreed that state and parliamentary seats under the coalition would be contested by the incumbent parties

    “If the seat’s incumbent is from Bersatu, then Bersatu will take it

    Meanwhile PAS president Tan Sri Abdul Hadi Awang said the party was dismayed over what he described as the hasty dissolution of Parliament

    “PAS is disappointed on the situation where parliament has to be dissolved in such a hasty manner at just four years and five months through the 14th Parliament,” he said in a statement

    — Bernama However, Abdul Hadi said the party was optimistic its efforts to unite the Ummah would not fail

    “On that note, PAS is calling on the people to fulfil their responsibility as a voter in this important general election,” he said

    “PAS with the Perikatan Nasional coalition will go all out to ensure we win in the next general election,” he said

    Gerakan president Dr Dominic Lau said the party had been long prepared for the snap polls

    “Not only are we prepared for the election but also our preparation for flash floods, especially in flood-prone areas in Pahang and Kelantan, is also in high gear

    for elections EC to meet soon, application for postal votes now open What happens now that Parliament is dissolved Sabah parties want political uncertainty resolved via polls All astir in alphabet soup Sabah ‘Dissolution of Parliament timely’ Penangites can’t wait to vote in political stability Dissolution of Parliament is the best way forward, says Umno

  • LIVERPOOL TOLD THEY HAD A £36M ‘GHOST’ PLAYING YESTERDAY, ONLY HAD 27 TOUCHES

    10/11/2022

    44.44% Shortened!

    It’s becoming a worrying theme of the Reds’ season, Salah’s woes in front of goal

    However, the Liverpool forward has only managed three goals from open play across the Premier League and Champions League since August

    Salah is only a ghost of himself right now.” There’s no question that Salah is capable of turning around this slump and reminding English football why he’s been such a devastating force since joining Liverpool for £36 million in 2017 [The Guardian]

    Salah has struggled at times before, but the Reds overall were still playing excellent and therefore there was less pressure on the main man

    But it’s entirely different now and if Liverpool don’t improve as a unit, or Salah continues to struggle, then Jurgen Klopp’s side are in big, big trouble

    ['liverpool', 'salah', 'red', 'season', 'goal']

  • SOUTH KOREA'S WILD RUN TO THE 2002 WORLD CUP SEMI-FINALS

    https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-11299483/South-Koreas-wild-run-2002-World-Cup-semi-finals.html

    10/11/2022

    77.08% Shortened!

    Here is the incredible tale of South Korea's passage to the World Cup semi-finals

    South Korea enjoyed a memorable run to the semi-finals of the 2002 World Cup finals The 2002 World Cup began without much incident for one of the tournament's co-hosts

    Most suspected there would be no drama and his side would coast to a quarter-final berth

    'If Spain didn't win it's because they didn't let us win.'   South Korea, backed by a vociferous home crowd, went on to win the tie on penalties to become the first Asian team to reach the semi-finals of a World Cup

    Spain's Fernando Morientes had a goal controversially ruled out in the quarter-final As the European heavyweights of Italy and Spain fumed back at home, South Korea were into the last four

    They were as good off the pitch as their team were on it.  South Korea were beaten by Germany in the semi-finals as Michael Ballack celebrates Victory over Spain sent them into a semi-final showdown with Germany and that was where their run would end.  But a South Korean side written off as no-hopers had captured the imagination of their country - and the world - and ensured they would go down in World Cup folklore

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual We will automatically post your comment and a link to the news story to your Facebook timeline at the same time it is posted on MailOnline

    To do this we will link your MailOnline account with your Facebook account

    We’ll ask you to confirm this for your first post to Facebook

    You can choose on each post whether you would like it to be posted to Facebook

    ['south', 'korea', 'final', 'world', 'italy']

  • PAKATAN WOULD RISK SELANGOR, N. SEMBILAN WITH ASYNCHRONOUS POLLS, OBSERVERS WARN

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/11/pakatan-would-risk-selangor-n-sembilan-with-asynchronous-polls-observers-warn/32841

    10/11/2022, 07:34

    50.0% Shortened!

    The coalition could even see its control of Penang — currently a stronghold — erode if it were to have the state elections separately from the 15th general election set to be held next month, they cautioned

    They said the Opposition coalition would have an equal fight against the Barisan Nasional (BN) and Perikatan Nasional (PN) election machinery in GE15, but not so if the state elections were only held next year

    “It was proven previously that when state elections were held, PH lost,” said Universiti Utara Malaysia (UUM) Associate Professor Mohd Azizuddin Mohd Sani

    Mohd Azizuddin explained that PH would need high voter turnouts to defend the states successfully, but this would typically be low for standalone state elections

    However, Oh conceded that if PH were to also hold the state polls during GE15, its resources would also have to be spread thin

    Universiti Malaysia socioeconomic analyst Awang Azman Awang Pawi said Penang would remain as a PH stronghold regardless of when the state poll were to be called, noting that the coalition currently holds all but seven seats in the assembly

    He also believed that while an undistracted BN would be able to bring all its might to bear on the state, it would only be likely to claw back some of the ground lost since 2008

    However, he said the situation in Selangor and Negri Sembilan would be different

    “PH might lose those two states if they don’t hold the state polls during GE15,” he said

    Ismail Sabri announced the dissolution of Parliament yesterday, ending the speculation of when GE15 would be held

    The floods were particularly severe in Selangor, the country’s most industrialised state, where nearly half of the 54 flood-related deaths occurred.

    ['state', 'year', 'election', 'held', 'say']

    The coalition could even see its control of Penang — currently a stronghold — erode if it were to have the state elections separately from the 15th general election set to be held next month, they cautioned

    They said the Opposition coalition would have an equal fight against the Barisan Nasional (BN) and Perikatan Nasional (PN) election machinery in GE15, but not so if the state elections were only held next year

    “It was proven previously that when state elections were held, PH lost,” said Universiti Utara Malaysia (UUM) Associate Professor Mohd Azizuddin Mohd Sani

    Mohd Azizuddin explained that PH would need high voter turnouts to defend the states successfully, but this would typically be low for standalone state elections

    However, Oh conceded that if PH were to also hold the state polls during GE15, its resources would also have to be spread thin

    Universiti Malaysia socioeconomic analyst Awang Azman Awang Pawi said Penang would remain as a PH stronghold regardless of when the state poll were to be called, noting that the coalition currently holds all but seven seats in the assembly

    He also believed that while an undistracted BN would be able to bring all its might to bear on the state, it would only be likely to claw back some of the ground lost since 2008

    However, he said the situation in Selangor and Negri Sembilan would be different

    “PH might lose those two states if they don’t hold the state polls during GE15,” he said

    Ismail Sabri announced the dissolution of Parliament yesterday, ending the speculation of when GE15 would be held

    The floods were particularly severe in Selangor, the country’s most industrialised state, where nearly half of the 54 flood-related deaths occurred.

    ['state', 'year', 'election', 'held', 'say']



  • NATO MEMBERS TIGHTEN SECURITY AS G7 LEADERS DISCUSS RUSSIA'S ASSAULT ON UKRAINE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2022/10/11/ukraine-vows-to-strengthen-its-armed-forces-after-major-russian-air-strikes

    10/11/2022, 07:05

    73.17% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 11 Oct 2022

    A driver walks near his burned car after Russian military strike, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in central Kyiv, Ukraine October 10, 2022

    Belarus, Moscow's closest ally, said it had begun an exercise to assess its "combat readiness" after ordering troops on Monday to deploy with Russian forces near its border with Ukraine

    Belarus allowed Russia to use its territory to invade Ukraine but has not yet sent its own troops across the border

    Air raid sirens earlier wailed across Ukraine for a second day

    President Joe Biden and other G7 leaders met virtually on Tuesday to discuss what more they could do to support Ukraine and they heard President Volodymyr Zelenskiy plead for air defence systems, which he has called his "number 1 priority"

    Zelenskiy said Russia had started a new stage of escalation, so new sanctions were needed, and he called for an international monitoring mission on Ukraine's border with Belarus

    Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko has repeatedly accused Ukraine of preparing to attack his country, though he has offered no evidence and Kyiv denies any such plan

    MORE STRIKES Russia said it continued to launch long-range air strikes on Ukraine's energy and military infrastructure on Tuesday

    In an overnight video address from the scene of one of the attacks in Kyiv, Zelenskiy promised Ukraine would keep fighting

    Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said Russia would not turn down a meeting between Putin and Biden at a forthcoming G20 meeting and would consider the proposal if it receives one

    ['tuesday', 'russia', 'ukraine', 'say', 'attack']

    Tuesday, 11 Oct 2022

    A driver walks near his burned car after Russian military strike, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in central Kyiv, Ukraine October 10, 2022

    Belarus, Moscow's closest ally, said it had begun an exercise to assess its "combat readiness" after ordering troops on Monday to deploy with Russian forces near its border with Ukraine

    Belarus allowed Russia to use its territory to invade Ukraine but has not yet sent its own troops across the border

    Air raid sirens earlier wailed across Ukraine for a second day

    President Joe Biden and other G7 leaders met virtually on Tuesday to discuss what more they could do to support Ukraine and they heard President Volodymyr Zelenskiy plead for air defence systems, which he has called his "number 1 priority"

    Zelenskiy said Russia had started a new stage of escalation, so new sanctions were needed, and he called for an international monitoring mission on Ukraine's border with Belarus

    Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko has repeatedly accused Ukraine of preparing to attack his country, though he has offered no evidence and Kyiv denies any such plan

    MORE STRIKES Russia said it continued to launch long-range air strikes on Ukraine's energy and military infrastructure on Tuesday

    In an overnight video address from the scene of one of the attacks in Kyiv, Zelenskiy promised Ukraine would keep fighting

    Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said Russia would not turn down a meeting between Putin and Biden at a forthcoming G20 meeting and would consider the proposal if it receives one

    ['tuesday', 'russia', 'ukraine', 'say', 'attack']



  • WHAT HAPPENS NOW THAT PARLIAMENT IS DISSOLVED

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/11/what-happens-now-that-parliament-is-dissolved

    10/11/2022, 07:05

    50.0% Shortened!

    The Election Commission (EC) then has to spring into action and announce a nomination date and a polling date within 60 days from the date of dissolution

    However, there is no provision for a caretaker government in the Malaysian Constitution

    The notion of a caretaker government is essentially a parliamentary or constitutional convention in line with the Westminster parliamentary system

    This means the incumbent government will automatically be the caretaker government, unless the caretaker prime minister hands the reins to another minister to stand in his place, as happened in 1959

    As for Budget 2023, it will have to be retabled as the new government is not bound by a budget tabled by the previous government.The whole process from the first reading will be repeated once the new government has been formed after the elections are over

    In the ministries, there will be no handing over of new contracts or government projects, as everything has to go through Parliament

    Government promises, such as grants for businesses or gadgets for schoolchildren, if these have been passed and signed upon by the ministers before the dissolution of Parliament, can still be continued to be handed out

    Officiation of events such as the opening of new health clinics by the caretaker prime minister or ministers, which have been agreed and signed before the dissolution can still be carried out, so as not to disrupt the continued services for the rakyat

    There will be no stop to the civil service under the caretaker government

    The caretaker government will function without disruption until the next Prime Minister is appointed according to the Federal Constitution

    Then, it will be the end of the caretaker government and the beginning of a new government

    ['minister', 'dissolution', 'parliament', 'caretaker', 'government']

    The Election Commission (EC) then has to spring into action and announce a nomination date and a polling date within 60 days from the date of dissolution

    However, there is no provision for a caretaker government in the Malaysian Constitution

    The notion of a caretaker government is essentially a parliamentary or constitutional convention in line with the Westminster parliamentary system

    This means the incumbent government will automatically be the caretaker government, unless the caretaker prime minister hands the reins to another minister to stand in his place, as happened in 1959

    As for Budget 2023, it will have to be retabled as the new government is not bound by a budget tabled by the previous government.The whole process from the first reading will be repeated once the new government has been formed after the elections are over

    In the ministries, there will be no handing over of new contracts or government projects, as everything has to go through Parliament

    Government promises, such as grants for businesses or gadgets for schoolchildren, if these have been passed and signed upon by the ministers before the dissolution of Parliament, can still be continued to be handed out

    Officiation of events such as the opening of new health clinics by the caretaker prime minister or ministers, which have been agreed and signed before the dissolution can still be carried out, so as not to disrupt the continued services for the rakyat

    There will be no stop to the civil service under the caretaker government

    The caretaker government will function without disruption until the next Prime Minister is appointed according to the Federal Constitution

    Then, it will be the end of the caretaker government and the beginning of a new government

    ['minister', 'dissolution', 'parliament', 'caretaker', 'government']



  • UKRAINE LEADER TO MAKE CASE TO G7 FOR MORE ARMS AFTER DEADLY RUSSIA STRIKES

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2022/10/11/ukraine-vows-to-strengthen-its-armed-forces-after-major-russian-air-strikes

    10/11/2022, 07:04

    56.0% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 11 Oct 2022

    A driver walks near his burned car after Russian military strike, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in central Kyiv, Ukraine October 10, 2022

    President Joe Biden and other Group of Seven leaders will convene virtually later on Tuesday to discuss what more they can do to support Ukraine and to listen to Zelenskiy who has called air defence systems his "number 1 priority," something Biden has already promised to provide

    BELARUS FEARS G7 leaders may also warn Belarus, a close Russian ally, against closer involvement in the war after Minsk said on Monday it was deploying its soldiers with Russian forces near Ukraine in response to what it said was a clear threat to Belarus from Kyiv and its backers in the West

    French Foreign Minister Catherine Colonna told France Inter radio on Tuesday that G7 heads of state would probably warn Belarus, which is already used by Russia as a logistics base and as a platform from which to fire missiles, not to get more involved

    Russia's deputy foreign minister warned Russia would respond to the West's growing involvement in the Ukraine conflict

    "We warn and hope that they realise the danger of uncontrolled escalation in Washington and other Western capitals," Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov was quoted as saying by RIA news agency on Tuesday

    Anatoly Antonov, Russia's ambassador to the United States, said more Western help to Ukraine raised the risk of a wider war

    Russia suffered a diplomatic setback on Monday, as the U.N

    Report it to us

  • TEN HAG IN SERIOUS DANGER OF TURNING MAJOR MAN UTD STAR AGAINST HIM, WITH KEY REQUEST 'TAKING HIS BASIC RIGHTS AWAY'

    https://www.teamtalk.com/manchester-united/ten-hag-serious-danger-turning-major-man-utd-star-against-him-key-request-taking-basic-rights-away

    10/11/2022, 07:03

    63.33% Shortened!

    Premier League • England Erik ten Hag has been lambasted for his handling of Antony, with a pundit claiming one of the Man Utd manager’s key requests will turn the Brazilian against him

    Antony was Manchester United’s marquee signing over the summer

    Antony tracked back well in the 2-1 victory over Everton on Sunday

    Antony’s defensive workrate was hailed by Ten Hag post-match

    “In the first game, he was not always that good defending-wise but today he was really good, really disciplined,” Ten Hag said of Antony (via the Manchester Evening News)

    What’s more, the former West Ham and Celtic striker claimed it won’t be long before Antony gets “fed up” with Ten Hag’s demand

    He will get fed up with it

    However, Antony’s three goals in three league matches so far suggest he’s even more potent than in Amsterdam

    What’s more, Ten Hag’s tactics closely mirror those he deployed at Ajax

    Defensive duties are therefore no stranger to Antony

    It stands to reason he knew he’d be asked to contribute in his own half upon signing for Ten Hag at Manchester United

    ['ten', 'hag', 'antony', 'man', 'manchester']

  • UKRAINE VOWS TO STRENGTHEN ITS ARMED FORCES AFTER MAJOR RUSSIAN AIR STRIKES

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2022/10/11/ukraine-vows-to-strengthen-its-armed-forces-after-major-russian-air-strikes

    10/11/2022, 07:03

    75.56% Shortened!

    A driver walks near his burned car after Russian military strike, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in central Kyiv, Ukraine October 10, 2022

    A total of 14 people were killed and 97 were injured, the State Emergency Service of Ukraine reported

    Russia blamed Ukraine and called the deadly explosion "terrorism"

    He threatened more strikes in future if Ukraine hits Russian territory

    "That's not to say that the explosion on the Crimea bridge might have accelerated some of their planning." Ukraine, which views the bridge as a military target sustaining Russia's war effort, celebrated the blast without claiming responsibility

    On Saturday, Russia made its third senior military appointment in the space of a week by appointing Air Force General Sergei Surovikin as commander of Russian forces in Ukraine

    He previously commanded Russia's brutal air campaign in Syria

    Russia says it is waging a "special military operation" in Ukraine to rid it of nationalists and protect Russian-speaking communities

    Ukraine and the West say it is an unprovoked war of aggression

    Ukraine's defence ministry said in its evening update Russia had staged at least 84 missile and air strikes, and Ukraine's air defences had destroyed 43 cruise missiles and 13 drones

    Russia's defence ministry said it had hit all its intended targets

    ['russian', 'russia', 'ukraine', 'say', 'air']

    Russian President Vladimir Putin said he ordered "massive" long-range strikes after accusing Ukraine of an attack on the bridge linking Russia to annexed Crimea on Saturday

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2022/10/11/ukraine-vows-to-strengthen-its-armed-forces-after-major-russian-air-strikes

    10/11/2022, 06:34

    71.79% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 11 Oct 2022

    A driver walks near his burned car after Russian military strike, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in central Kyiv, Ukraine October 10, 2022

    Ukrainians woke up to the wailing of new air raid sirens on Tuesday, with parts of the country left without power

    Officials said 19 were killed on Monday in cruise missile strikes across the country, the biggest air raids since the start of the war

    Kyiv and its allies condemned Russia's strikes, which mainly hit civil infrastructure such as power stations

    President Joe Biden and other Group of Seven leaders will convene virtually later on Tuesday to discuss what more they can do to support Ukraine and to listen to Zelenskiy, who has called air defence systems his "number 1 priority"

    Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine's sixth largest city, has remained under Ukrainian control throughout the war, despite Russia occupying most of the surrounding province, among four partially occupied regions that Moscow claims to have annexed this month

    In an overnight video address from the scene of one of the attacks in Kyiv, Zelenskiy promised that Ukraine would keep fighting

    BELARUS FEARS G7 leaders are also expected to issue a warning Belarus, Moscow's closest ally, against deeper involvement in the war, after Minsk said on Monday it was deploying soldiers with Russian forces near Ukraine in response to what it called a threat from Kyiv and its Western allies

    "That is a violation of the rules of war and international law." Moscow has accused the West of escalating the conflict by supporting Ukraine

    Russia suffered a diplomatic setback on Monday, as the U.N

    ['tuesday', 'russia', 'ukraine', 'kyiv', 'ukrainian']

  • UKRAINE VOWS TO STRENGTHEN ARMED FORCES AFTER RUSSIAN STRIKES

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2022/10/11/ukraine-vows-to-strengthen-its-armed-forces-after-major-russian-air-strikes

    10/11/2022, 06:33

    75.0% Shortened!

    A driver walks near his burned car after Russian military strike, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in central Kyiv, Ukraine October 10, 2022

    Russia's ambassador to the United States, Anatoly Antonov, said more help to Ukraine raised the risk of a wider war

    Russia blamed Ukraine and called the deadly explosion "terrorism"

    He threatened more strikes if Ukraine hits Russian territory

    "That's not to say that the explosion on the Crimea bridge might have accelerated some of their planning." Ukraine, which views the bridge as a military target sustaining Russia's war effort, celebrated the blast without claiming responsibility

    On Saturday, Russia made its third senior military appointment in the space of a week with air force General Sergei Surovikin taking over as commander of forces in Ukraine

    He previously commanded Russia's brutal air campaign in Syria

    Russia says it is waging a "special military operation" in Ukraine to rid it of nationalists and protect Russian-speaking communities

    Ukraine and the West say it is an unprovoked war of aggression

    Ukraine's defence ministry said in a Monday evening update Russia had staged at least 84 missile and air strikes, and Ukraine's air defences had destroyed 43 cruise missiles and 13 drones

    Russia's defence ministry said it had hit all its intended targets

    ['russian', 'strike', 'russia', 'ukraine', 'war']

    A driver walks near his burned car after Russian military strike, as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, in central Kyiv, Ukraine October 10, 2022

    Russia's ambassador to the United States, Anatoly Antonov, said more help to Ukraine raised the risk of a wider war

    Russia blamed Ukraine and called the deadly explosion "terrorism"

    He threatened more strikes if Ukraine hits Russian territory

    "That's not to say that the explosion on the Crimea bridge might have accelerated some of their planning." Ukraine, which views the bridge as a military target sustaining Russia's war effort, celebrated the blast without claiming responsibility

    On Saturday, Russia made its third senior military appointment in the space of a week with air force General Sergei Surovikin taking over as commander of forces in Ukraine

    He previously commanded Russia's brutal air campaign in Syria

    Russia says it is waging a "special military operation" in Ukraine to rid it of nationalists and protect Russian-speaking communities

    Ukraine and the West say it is an unprovoked war of aggression

    Ukraine's defence ministry said in a Monday evening update Russia had staged at least 84 missile and air strikes, and Ukraine's air defences had destroyed 43 cruise missiles and 13 drones

    Russia's defence ministry said it had hit all its intended targets

    ['russian', 'strike', 'russia', 'ukraine', 'war']

    Monday’s 4-0 thumping at Leicester City left Forest rock bottom of the Premier League

    He has been named on the substitute's bench for the head-to-head with Steven Gerrard's side

    Cooper is putting his stamp on things after signing a shock new three-year contract as Forest gaffer

    The 42-year-old took over from Chris Hughton last September and led Forest from relegation candidates to Championship play-off winners last season in a superb turnaround

    Goals are the only currency that matter in football and Ronaldo has scored them in abundance

    Erik ten Hag (right) might not be in a position to let Ronaldo go when the window next reopens GOLD STANDARD As United strive to bring the glory days back to Old Trafford, there can be no better benchmark than Ronaldo

    10/11/2022, 06:05

    Anwar, who is also PKR president, said media reports which went viral today claiming PH had rejected Muda were not true

    (rejected Muda), we are still negotiating and there is progress,” he said briefly to reporters after the PKR Central Leadership Council (MPP) special meeting at the PKR headquarters here last night

    Anwar had earlier chaired the meeting, which began at 9.40pm, and it was also attended by PKR deputy president Rafizi Ramli, vice-president Datuk Seri Aminuddin Harun, who is also Negri Sembilan Menteri Besar, Women’s wing chief Fadhlina Sidek and Youth chief Adam Adli as well as the MPP members

    According to him, the meeting, which was held following the dissolution of Parliament as announced by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob today, among others discussed the preparation of the PKR election machinery as well as the party’s desire to contest in more Parliamentary seats in GE15

  • VANGUARD, FIDELITY WILL JOIN A 401(K) AUTO-PORTABILITY NETWORK TO RESCUE $1.5 TRILLION IN RETIREMENT SAVINGS

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/vanguard-fidelity-join-401-k-185925000.html

    66.67% Shortened!

    If auto-portability gets adopted nationwide, these companies say that it can help Americans preserve $1.5 trillion in additional retirement savings

    Let's break down what this collaboration means, how auto portability works and what you can do to avoid losing retirement money when you change jobs

    Fidelity Investments, Vanguard, Alight Solutions and Retirement Clearinghouse are creating an auto-portability network to help workers avoid losing money in taxes and penalties when they cash out small retirement account balances after switching jobs

    The press release announcing the auto-portability network in October says that this automated process focuses on account balances under $5,000; and if auto-portability gets adopted nationwide, it can help Americans preserve $1.5 trillion in additional retirement savings over 40 years

    "Workers with less than $5,000-the focus of the auto portability service-cash out at the time of their job change at much higher rates than all job-changing workers." For reference, an auto-portability bill proposed by U.S

    The press release says that the auto-portability network currently represents almost 44 million workers in more than 48,000 employer-sponsored retirement plans

    Employees leaving a workplace can generally keep their 401(k) where it is, roll it over into another account with a new employer or transfer the money to an individual retirement account (IRA)

    And as noted earlier by the Retirement Clearinghouse, a 25-year-old with $5,000 in retirement savings can see it grow to $70,000 over time

    And transferring your 401(k) balance to another account with a new employer will also allow you to put all of your retirement money in one place

    Bottom Line Fidelity Investments, Vanguard, Alight Solutions and Retirement Clearinghouse are creating an auto-portability network to help workers changing jobs avoid taxes and penalties from cashing out small retirement balances

    You can boost your retirement savings instead by keeping your money in an old 401(k) or rolling it over to a new 401(k) or an IRA account

    ['retirement', 'auto', 'portability', 'money', 'job']

    If auto-portability gets adopted nationwide, these companies say that it can help Americans preserve $1.5 trillion in additional retirement savings

    Fidelity Investments, Vanguard, Alight Solutions and Retirement Clearinghouse are creating an auto-portability network to help workers avoid losing money in taxes and penalties when they cash out small retirement account balances after switching jobs

    The press release announcing the auto-portability network in October says that this automated process focuses on account balances under $5,000; and if auto-portability gets adopted nationwide, it can help Americans preserve $1.5 trillion in additional retirement savings over 40 years

    "Workers with less than $5,000-the focus of the auto portability service-cash out at the time of their job change at much higher rates than all job-changing workers." For reference, an auto-portability bill proposed by U.S

    The press release says that the auto-portability network currently represents almost 44 million workers in more than 48,000 employer-sponsored retirement plans

    Employees leaving a workplace can generally keep their 401(k) where it is, roll it over into another account with a new employer or transfer the money to an individual retirement account (IRA)

    And as noted earlier by the Retirement Clearinghouse, a 25-year-old with $5,000 in retirement savings can see it grow to $70,000 over time

    And transferring your 401(k) balance to another account with a new employer will also allow you to put all of your retirement money in one place

    Bottom Line Fidelity Investments, Vanguard, Alight Solutions and Retirement Clearinghouse are creating an auto-portability network to help workers changing jobs avoid taxes and penalties from cashing out small retirement balances

    You can boost your retirement savings instead by keeping your money in an old 401(k) or rolling it over to a new 401(k) or an IRA account

  • DARWIN NÚÑEZ JUST SHOWED LIVERPOOL FUTURE BY DOING WHAT ROBERTO FIRMINO NEVER DID FOR JÜRGEN KLOPP

    https://www.liverpool.com/liverpool-fc-news/features/liverpool-darwin-nunez-roberto-firmino-25220375

    10/11/2022, 02:05

    42.11% Shortened!

    Darwin Núñez amassed more offsides against Arsenal than every other player on the pitch combined, and his running in behind captures Jürgen Klopp's tactical shift

    Darwin Núñez started up front for Liverpool in a high-profile bout against Arsenal, and after being found by a Kostas Tsimikas pass, he was flagged offside

    He was Liverpool's biggest threat in the game, with his tendency to drift offside offering an insight into the tactical shift that Jürgen Klopp is currently experiencing

    Time his runs slightly better, and he could get considerably more joy

    If you enjoyed this piece, you'll love our latest project here on Liverpool.com — our new-look, exclusive newsletter, which is sent each weekday only to people signed up for our mailing list

    Our newsletter subscribers get a rundown Monday to Friday from one of the best Liverpool FC writers — straight to your inbox, and completely for free

    Sign up to the Liverpool.com newsletter here — it only takes a few seconds! Klopp is almost swapping one for the other up top, even though both remain at the club, which could be having an impact on Liverpool's cohesion in comparison to previous campaigns

    Salah, who has always been the player to run in behind for the Reds, looks less involved than ever at present, occupying a wider role perhaps as a means of accommodating Núñez as the team's new pacey finisher

    Liverpool didn't plan on having a transition year but as a consequence of the results already picked up and the ongoing search for consistency, Klopp might have to appreciate that his squad has experienced quite a subtle yet dramatic change in the past few months, especially considering Mané has also been sold

    Right now, the Anfield outfit appear to lack an identity

    It is not impossible for every Reds player to flourish on the pitch at the same time; Klopp simply has to find a means of getting his players to work as a connected unit once more.

  • UMNO MOOTS GE15 IN EARLY NOVEMBER, BEFORE FLOODS HIT

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/11/umno-moots-ge15-in-early-november-before-floods-hit/32862

    10/11/2022

    42.86% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 11 — Umno has suggested that the 15th general election (GE15) be held by early November to avoid the flood season, said Datuk Seri Ahmad Maslan

    The Malay nationalist party’s secretary-general added, however, that Umno would leave it to the judgement of the Election Commission (EC) to decide when the poll should be conducted

    “Umno believes that GE15 can be held before mid-November, which is before the arrival of the flood season or the monsoon season,” said Ahmad after the party’s supreme council meeting at World Trade Centre (WTC) here last night Umno also lauded the Yang di-Pertuan Agong for giving his royal assent to dissolve Parliament and returning the mandate to Malaysians

    He said his party believed that a fresh general election was the best way to end the country’s political instability stemming from the informal coalition government

    ['umno', 'general', 'election', 'ge15', 'held']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 11 — Umno has suggested that the 15th general election (GE15) be held by early November to avoid the flood season, said Datuk Seri Ahmad Maslan

    The Malay nationalist party’s secretary-general added, however, that Umno would leave it to the judgement of the Election Commission (EC) to decide when the poll should be conducted

    “Umno believes that GE15 can be held before mid-November, which is before the arrival of the flood season or the monsoon season,” said Ahmad after the party’s supreme council meeting at World Trade Centre (WTC) here last night Umno also lauded the Yang di-Pertuan Agong for giving his royal assent to dissolve Parliament and returning the mandate to Malaysians

    He said his party believed that a fresh general election was the best way to end the country’s political instability stemming from the informal coalition government

    ['umno', 'general', 'election', 'ge15', 'held']

  • PAYPAL TELLS USERS IT WILL FINE THEM $2,500 FOR MISINFORMATION, THEN BACKTRACKS IMMEDIATELY

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/paypal-tells-users-fine-them-111951288.html

    42.11% Shortened!

    A new policy in PayPal’s fine print triggered a storm of outrage over apparent plans to impose, starting on Nov

    PayPal quickly apologized over the weekend for what it called “confusion”, claiming it was all just an error, but not before a a deluge of criticism from a number of high-profile individuals—including its own former president, David Marcus

    Marcus took to Twitter to say the new Acceptable Use Policy (AUP) was an “insanity” that forced him to come forward and criticize his previous employer, where he worked for three years from 2011 after former PayPal owner eBay acquired a company he founded and joined it with the payments service

    “PayPal’s new AUP goes against everything I believe in,” he posted on Saturday

    “PayPal is not fining people for misinformation and this language was never intended to be inserted in our policy,” a spokesperson later told media outlets over the weekend

    “PayPal freezing funds for thought crimes is despicable,” he wrote over the weekend in response to the controversy

    Marcus, the former PayPal president, is himself a fan of Bitcoin and later ran Meta's project to develop a crypto wallet

    PayPal's supposed new policy only exacerbated a common fear in the crypto community that the state will eventually seek to sideline virtual assets through the introduction of central bank digital currencies

    The intense blowback will not likely be helpful for PayPal shares, which have thus far been a poor investment in 2022

    While payment services giant Visa declined by only 15% year-to-date, PayPal has more than halved in value

    Shares in PayPal are expected to open 1.5% lower on Monday, underperforming the broader tech market

    ['company', 'service', 'new', 'policy', 'paypal']

    A new policy in PayPal’s fine print triggered a storm of outrage over apparent plans to impose, starting on Nov

    PayPal quickly apologized over the weekend for what it called “confusion”, claiming it was all just an error, but not before a a deluge of criticism from a number of high-profile individuals—including its own former president, David Marcus

    Marcus took to Twitter to say the new Acceptable Use Policy (AUP) was an “insanity” that forced him to come forward and criticize his previous employer, where he worked for three years from 2011 after former PayPal owner eBay acquired a company he founded and joined it with the payments service

    “PayPal’s new AUP goes against everything I believe in,” he posted on Saturday

    While payment services giant Visa declined by only 15% year-to-date, PayPal has more than halved in value

    Shares in PayPal are expected to open 1.5% lower on Monday, underperforming the broader tech market

    ['company', 'service', 'new', 'policy', 'paypal']



  • BEWARE: YOU COULD LOSE YOUR 401(K)

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/lose-401-k-155108846.html

    76.6% Shortened!

    If you have just a small amount of money in it, your employer might cash it out or ask you to move the money to a different account

    If your balance is between $1,000 and $5,000, your employer may require you to move it

    If your balance is over $5,000, your employer cannot move your money or require you to do so

    In this case, you can roll it into an IRA or simply leave the money in the old plan

    But your employer can still force you to move your money in this situation

    Vested Balance Any money you contribute to your 401(k), such as money contributed via payroll deduction, is money you can’t lose

    That employer can’t take that money from you, even if you leave the company entirely

    What Happens to My 401(k) Loan? Some employer-sponsored retirement plans allow you to take a loan against the balance of the plan

    Bottom Line While it is possible to lose some money with your retirement plan after you leave your job, it’s unlikely you will lose all of it

    However, you could lose your employer match if you aren’t fully vested

    In addition, there are some cases where you could end up having to pay taxes and penalties on money from your old retirement plan

    ['employer', 'retirement', 'plan', 'money', 'may']

    If you have just a small amount of money in it, your employer might cash it out or ask you to move the money to a different account

    If your balance is between $1,000 and $5,000, your employer may require you to move it

    If your balance is over $5,000, your employer cannot move your money or require you to do so

    In this case, you can roll it into an IRA or simply leave the money in the old plan

    But your employer can still force you to move your money in this situation

    Vested Balance Any money you contribute to your 401(k), such as money contributed via payroll deduction, is money you can’t lose

    That employer can’t take that money from you, even if you leave the company entirely

    What Happens to My 401(k) Loan? Some employer-sponsored retirement plans allow you to take a loan against the balance of the plan

    Bottom Line While it is possible to lose some money with your retirement plan after you leave your job, it’s unlikely you will lose all of it

    However, you could lose your employer match if you aren’t fully vested

    In addition, there are some cases where you could end up having to pay taxes and penalties on money from your old retirement plan

    ['employer', 'retirement', 'plan', 'money', 'may']



  • 2 “STRONG BUY” STOCKS WITH HIGH-YIELDING DIVIDENDS

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/2-strong-buy-stocks-high-221740394.html

    76.6% Shortened!

    Each stock also holds a Strong Buy consensus rating; let’s see what makes them so attractive to Wall Street’s analysts

    In the last reported quarter, 2Q22, WPC showed a 7.7% year-over-year gain in total revenues, from $319.7 million in the year-ago quarter to $344.4 million in the current report

    These factors continue to favorably position the company to outperform, in our view.” This reinforces the analyst's view that WPC is a stock to "buy," and worth a $93 target price

    At current levels, this target suggests ~30% upside for the year ahead

    (To watch Germain’s track record, click here) Germain is bullish, but he’s far from the only bull on this stock

    WPC has 5 recent analyst reviews, and these include 4 to Buy against just 1 Hold, for a Strong Buy consensus rating

    The company had a total rental revenue of $387 million, and revenue from resident fees and services of $125.3 million

    Add on interest income of $5.5 million, and the company showed a total top line of approximately $517.9 million

    With those funds available, the company paid out it most recent dividend, in August, of 30 cents per share

    With an annualized rate of $1.20, the dividend yields 5.3%

    The stock is selling for $21.90 and its average target, at $31.67, implies a gain of ~45% in the next 12 months

    ['market', 'stock', 'dividend', 'buy', 'company']

  • ANWAR: PUNISH THE TRAITORS IN GE15

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/10/anwar-punish-the-traitors-in-ge15/32847

    10/11/2022, 00:04

    44.44% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 10 — Pakatan Harapan chairman Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim said the 15th general election would allow voters to punish those behind the Sheraton Move that plunged the country into political instability

    “Do not be deceived by the government that only prioritise their own interests when they are returning the mandate to the people

    “Yes, it’s true that we must hold an election and because of that heinous betrayal that caused the fall of Pakatan Harapan’s government, this is the long-awaited moment for us to punish the traitors,” said Anwar in a statement today

    In the so-called “Sheraton Move” in February 2020, the political defection of Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia and several PKR lawmakers caused the collapse of the Pakatan Harapan government

    “To the young people who will vote, I emphasise that the choice of the upcoming election will have a great impact on the future of the people and the country,” he added

    ['pakatan', 'harapan', 'anwar', 'election', 'would']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 10 — Pakatan Harapan chairman Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim said the 15th general election would allow voters to punish those behind the Sheraton Move that plunged the country into political instability

    “Do not be deceived by the government that only prioritise their own interests when they are returning the mandate to the people

    “Yes, it’s true that we must hold an election and because of that heinous betrayal that caused the fall of Pakatan Harapan’s government, this is the long-awaited moment for us to punish the traitors,” said Anwar in a statement today

    In the so-called “Sheraton Move” in February 2020, the political defection of Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia and several PKR lawmakers caused the collapse of the Pakatan Harapan government

    “To the young people who will vote, I emphasise that the choice of the upcoming election will have a great impact on the future of the people and the country,” he added

    ['pakatan', 'harapan', 'anwar', 'election', 'would']



  • CONTRIBUTIONS FROM SELF-EMPLOYED TO BE MANDATORY SOON, SAYS SOCSO

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/10/contributions-from-self-employed-to-be-mandatory-soon-says-socso

    10/10/2022

    57.69% Shortened!

    Monday, 10 Oct 2022

    He said the government will bear 80% of the scheme's contribution for those who register

    The government would also continue to provide full contributions to self-employed workers serving as volunteers in the public sector such as the Civil Defence Force and the People's Volunteer Corps (Rela)

    Meanwhile, to address the national unemployment rate, Azman said Sosco has been given a RM150mil allocation by the government to implement an Employment Incentive Programme that would create career opportunities for over 70,000 job seekers nationwide

    The employment initiative also allows employers to replace foreign workers with locals through the Malaysianisation programme, he added

    Socso and the Human Resource Development Corporation (HRD Corp) will also establish a National Placement Centre in the Klang Valley to act as a one-stop centre and lifelong learning centre for the purpose of giving graduates exposure to the current labour market

    Azman said Sosco is also responsible for performing health screening for workers

    When tabling Budget 2023 on Friday (Oct 7), Finance Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Tengku Abdul Aziz said it would be compulsory for self-employed workers to contribute to Socso, especially in high-risk sectors

    This was to safeguard the welfare of those in the self-employed sector, including gig economy workers

    Self-Employment Social Security Scheme

    Dr Mohammed Azman Aziz Mohammed

  • GE15: DAP RESPECTS DECISION ON POLLS, BUT PAKATAN-HELD STATES WON'T DISSOLVE ASSEMBLIES

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/10/ge15-dap-respects-decision-on-polls-but-pakatan-held-states-won039t-dissolve-assemblies

    10/10/2022, 19:35

    50.0% Shortened!

    Monday, 10 Oct 2022

    It will also back the Pakatan Harapan presidential council's decision not to dissolve the state assemblies of Penang, Selangor and Negri Sembilan

    The party will hold an emergency meeting on Tuesday (Oct 11) night to discuss the dissolution while its election machinery has already been activated, says DAP secretary-general Anthony Loke

    Loke, who was Seremban MP during the term of the 14th Parliament, said the party abides by the Pakatan presidential council decision not to dissolve the state assemblies of Penang, Selangor and Negri Sembilan

    "This is so the state governments can continue to focus on preparations in facing any possible disaster

    "Although we do not find the (timing for GE15) to be suitable, we respect the decision in accordance with the Federal Constitution

    "The DAP central executive committee will meet on Tuesday night to discuss preparations for the election," he added in a statement on Monday (Oct 10)

    Ismail Sabri announced the dissolution of Parliament with the consent of the King at 3pm Monday, paving the way for GE15

    Penang has 13 parliamentary constituencies and 40 state seats, Selangor has 22 parliamentary and 56 state seats, while Negri Sembilan has eight parliamentary and 36 state seats

    PAS president Tan Sri Abdul Hadi Awang had also said on Oct 8 that the Islamist party will not dissolve the Kedah, Kelantan, and Terengganu state assemblies simultaneously with Parliament

    Kedah has 36 state and 15 parliamentary seats, Terengganu has 32 state and eight parliamentary seats, while Kelantan has 45 state and 14 parliamentary seats.

    ['dap', 'parliament', 'say', 'state', 'face']

  • GE15: PERIKATAN RESPECTS DECISION TO HOLD ELECTION, SAYS MUHYIDDIN

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/10/ge15-perikatan-respects-decision-to-hold-election-says-muhyiddin

    10/10/2022, 19:34

    54.17% Shortened!

    Monday, 10 Oct 2022

    The former prime minister said Perikatan felt that it would be unsuitable to hold a general election at the moment due to the probability of floods and also other issues faced by the country

    "That is our view

    We respect the Constitution and the decision," said Muhyiddin at a press conference here on Monday (Oct 10)

    When asked whether the timing would work in favour or against Perikatan, Muhyiddin said the people were ready for it

    "I would say that the rakyat are facing a lot of problems but I think they want to exercise their right as voters to get a better government, a government that will take care of them

    Muhyiddin said the voter turnout was expected to be low but he hoped that would not happen

    On candidates, Muhyiddin said the Perikatan component parties had already started drawing their list of names to be fielded

    He said Perikatan would follow the principle of retaining incumbency of seats won by the respective parties

    Muhyiddin also said the cooperation between the Perikatan component parties was close and the coalition's election machinery would be organised under the single name of Perikatan.

    We would love to keep you posted on the latest promotion

  • PARLIAMENT DISSOLVED WITH KING'S CONSENT, SAYS ISMAIL SABRI

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/10/parliament-dissolved-with-king039s-consent-says-ismail-sabri

    10/10/2022, 16:05

    47.62% Shortened!

    Monday, 10 Oct 2022

    The Prime Minister said on Monday (Oct 10) that the King had given his formal consent to dissolve Parliament, paving the way for the 15th General Election (GE15) to be held within 60 days

    "I had an audience with the Yang di-Pertuan Agong on Sunday (Oct 9) afternoon

    He consented to the dissolution of Parliament on Monday in accordance with Article 40(2)(b) and Article 55(2) of the Federal Constitution," he said

    Ismail Sabri made the announcement in a special address broadcast live on local television and social media on Monday

    "It should be conducted at the same time to ensure that the rakyat are not burdened, aside from ensuring the smoothness of the democractic process and to save costs," said Ismail Sabri

    Ismail Sabri said that getting the people's mandate is the best method to ensure political stability and the formation of a solid, stable and respected government

    "The dissolution is being carried out to silence questions of the government's validity such as claims of a 'backdoor government'," he added

    Ismail Sabri said that he hopes the rakyat will use their power to choose a government that is able to resume the implementation of Budget 2023 and maintain political stability

    Ismail Sabri had an audience with Al-Sultan Abdullah on Sunday (Oct 9), the second time in four days

    On Thursday (Oct 6), Ismail Sabri had an audience with the King, which Istana Negara later explained was the routine weekly pre-Cabinet meeting

    ['oct', 'dissolution', 'parliament', 'say', 'ismail']

    Monday, 10 Oct 2022

    The Prime Minister said on Monday (Oct 10) that the King had given his formal consent to dissolve Parliament, paving the way for the 15th General Election (GE15) to be held within 60 days

    "I had an audience with the Yang di-Pertuan Agong on Sunday (Oct 9) afternoon

    He consented to the dissolution of Parliament on Monday in accordance with Article 40(2)(b) and Article 55(2) of the Federal Constitution," he said

    Ismail Sabri made the announcement in a special address broadcast live on local television and social media on Monday

    "It should be conducted at the same time to ensure that the rakyat are not burdened, aside from ensuring the smoothness of the democractic process and to save costs," said Ismail Sabri

    Ismail Sabri said that getting the people's mandate is the best method to ensure political stability and the formation of a solid, stable and respected government

    "The dissolution is being carried out to silence questions of the government's validity such as claims of a 'backdoor government'," he added

    Ismail Sabri said that he hopes the rakyat will use their power to choose a government that is able to resume the implementation of Budget 2023 and maintain political stability

    Ismail Sabri had an audience with Al-Sultan Abdullah on Sunday (Oct 9), the second time in four days

    On Thursday (Oct 6), Ismail Sabri had an audience with the King, which Istana Negara later explained was the routine weekly pre-Cabinet meeting

  • LOCKDOWN WORRIES RETURN TO SHANGHAI AS CHINA COVID-19 TALLY CLIMBS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2022/10/10/lockdown-worries-return-to-shanghai-as-china-covid-19-tally-climbs

    10/10/2022, 15:35

    68.57% Shortened!

    Monday, 10 Oct 2022

    Neighbours are seen at the entrance of a compound in lockdown in the Changning district, after new Covid-19 cases were reported in Shanghai, on Oct 8, 2022

    Shanghai posted 34 new local infections, the most in almost three months, with two infections found outside of its quarantine system

    In a sign of the tensions in the country, even a city that has zero infections has gone into lockdown

    In a commentary published Monday, the official People’s Daily newspaper said Covid Zero measures are scientific and virus variants remain a major threat to the elderly

    Some residential compounds under lockdown have received food supplies from the local government, and rumors about school suspension have been spreading

    Selina Liu, a 35-year-old auditor who lives in Shanghai, traveled to Yunnan during last week’s holiday and got stuck in a quarantine hotel during a local outbreak

    The lockdown of her hotel was lifted on Sunday and she was able to fly back to Shanghai after some of her earlier flight bookings were canceled

    Remarks from an official in the western region of Xinjiang, where some cities have been under lockdown for two months, also stirred controversy on social media

    Report it to us

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    ['lockdown', 'covid', 'case', 'report', 'shanghai']

    Monday, 10 Oct 2022

    Neighbours are seen at the entrance of a compound in lockdown in the Changning district, after new Covid-19 cases were reported in Shanghai, on Oct 8, 2022

    Shanghai posted 34 new local infections, the most in almost three months, with two infections found outside of its quarantine system

    https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/mohamed-salah-liverpool-analysis-breaking-25219075

    10/10/2022, 14:40

    50.0% Shortened!

    Liverpool analysis after defeat at Arsenal as Luis Diaz is injured and Mohamed Salah struggles Follow the latest transfer news and more with our LFC newsletter We have more newsletters Diaz and Salah suffer It was a grim afternoon for Liverpool’s wide players at the Emirates

    Until being booted out of the game by clumsy Arsenal midfielder Thomas Partey, Luis Diaz had been, like in so many recent outings, the Reds’ most dangerous forward

    That he was sat on the touchline as Liverpool chased in vain for a third equaliser spoke volumes

    Gomez opportunity knocks Any reminder of the Roy Hodgson era is enough to send a shiver down the spine of any Liverpool supporter who endured that dark period

    That, though, isn’t sufficient to explain the brittle nature of Liverpool’s performances away from Anfield this season, the defence again too easily prised apart

    Joe Gomez would not have wanted to make his 150th Liverpool appearance at the expense of the crocked Trent Alexander-Arnold, but there could now be an opening for him at right-back if his team-mate is sidelined for a period

    But at least Klopp now has options

    Bobby dazzles - briefly So continues Roberto Firmino’s Liverpool farewell tour

    On for the stricken Diaz, Firmino just took 11 minutes to impressively slot home Liverpool’s second equaliser, his 10th in the league against Arsenal – more than any other player in the Reds' history

    And with Nunez producing another encouraging all-round performance to go with his strike, there cannot be too many quibbles with Liverpool’s goal threat – even if their collective defending leaves much to be desired

    Klopp needs to find the right balance – and quickly

  • PAUL MERSON OVERJOYED BY 'PHENOMENAL' ARSENAL WIN; BARNES EXPLAINS HOW GUNNERS HAVE GROWN

    https://www.teamtalk.com/arsenal/paul-merson-overjoyed-phenomenal-win-john-barnes-gunners-grown

    10/10/2022, 13:04

    57.69% Shortened!

    Premier League • England Paul Merson has labelled Arsenal ‘outstanding’ and ‘phenomenal’ for how they handled Liverpool in their 3-2 Premier League victory at home

    “You’re looking for half time to come so you can settle and then they [Arsenal] go 2-1 up

    “Come out second half, then Liverpool get an equaliser again

    And then when they [Arsenal] scored, I thought Arsenal’s management of the game was phenomenal

    They’re top of the league [with] another game gone, keep on doing what they’re doing

    “I haven’t seen the place [Emirates Stadium] like this for a very long time.” Barnes went on to explain how this young Arsenal side has grown under Arteta. “Special praise to Arsenal because this young team could have capitulated after Liverpool came back to 1-1,” he said

    “Arsenal went 2-1 up, Liverpool came back to 2-2

    Can they manage the game? They did manage the game

    Once Liverpool come back, you think they’re going to go on [and win it] but Arsenal, as Paul said, managed the game well.” Jamie Redknapp, who was also on Sky Sports’ coverage of the match, added that this Arsenal team has more ‘character’ than in previous campaigns

    However, Arsenal remain top of the table and will have massive confidence about finally getting back into the top four, or potentially finishing second

    Meanwhile, Arteta has heaped praise on an Arsenal player who was ‘a nightmare’ for Liverpool to defend against.

    ['arsenal', 'liverpool', 'go', 'back', 'come']

  • CNN CREW ARRESTED FOR TRESPASS AT THAI MASSACRE SCENE FACE FINE, DEPORTATION

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2022/10/10/cnn-crew-arrested-for-trespass-at-thai-massacre-scene-face-fine-deportation

    10/10/2022, 11:05

    50.0% Shortened!

    Following the interrogation, assistant National Police chief Surachate Hakparn explained that Coren and Hodge had entered the crime scene after receiving permission from village health volunteers in the area

    CNN crew face fine, deportation after police find volunteers granted crime scene access Surachate said Coren and Hodge will initially face a fine of 5,000 to 10,000 baht for using tourist visas rather than media visa to report in Thailand

    The CNN crew will face further punishment if they are found to have broken trespass rules at the crime scene

    "If they are found guilty, they will face punishment before deportation," said the assistant police chief

    He added that so far, the police had not found evidence of wrongdoing by the CNN crew

    CNN crew face fine, deportation after police find volunteers granted crime scene access Deputy Prime Minister Prawit Wongsuwan said the CNN journalists were not permitted to report from inside the nursery despite receiving permission to enter

    Police would decide whether to take legal action against Coren and Hodge, he said

    CNN crew face fine, deportation after police find volunteers granted crime scene access Meanwhile, Public Health Minister Anutin Charnvirakul denied public health officials had granted access to the scene, contradicting an earlier claim by CNN

    He said that public health officials do not have authority at crime scenes but added his ministry would not file charges against the CNN reporters

    Report it to us

    Sevilla were in a title race last season and always finished in the top four under Lopetegui, but this weekend's draw saw them slip into the bottom three

    It has been a miserable season for them despite the quality of the squad

    His first game next weekend, away at sixth place Rennes, will be tough

    Finishing in the top three, which is where Lyon should be and aim to be, will be even harder

    You won't see a better goal this weekend and not many this season either

    To score it straight after half-time to give his team a two-goal lead was huge as well

    Ter Stegen has now kept seven clean sheets in eight league games this season, conceding just one goal in that time

  • ERIK TEN HAG PRAISES MAN UNITED'S COMPOSURE AFTER RED DEVILS COME FROM BEHIND TO BEAT EVERTON

    https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-11297787/Erik-ten-Hag-praises-Man-Uniteds-composure-Red-Devils-come-beat-Everton.html

    10/10/2022, 08:35

    52.17% Shortened!

    Speaking to BT Sport after the game, ten Hag said he was pleased with his team's composure, admitting it was something that has been worked on behind the scenes at the club.  Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag praised his side's character after their victory United beat Everton 2-1 after Cristiano Ronaldo netted his 700th career club goal  'We are quickly 1-0 down but the reaction of the team is good,' he said

    First half [we were] pressing well and it was hard for Everton to come to come into the game, we didn't allow them, happy with that.' The Dutchman praised midfielder Casemiro, who was making his first league start for the club after his summer move from Real Madrid

    Though he was at fault for Everton's goal, he got better as the game went on and put in an impressive performance

    The Dutchman explained how midfield star Casemiro is important to his United team The 30-year-old started slow but grew into the game on his first league start for the club ten Hag did, however, confirm Anthony Martial has picked up a new injury after the forward was subbed in the first half

    'Casemiro will anticipate quickly and you saw how important he is,' ten Hag said

    'The ball can always come in,' ten Hag added

  • ANTONY SENDS MESSAGE TO CRISTIANO RONALDO AFTER 700TH CLUB GOAL

    https://www.unitedinfocus.com/news/antony-sends-message-to-cristiano-ronaldo-after-700th-club-goal/

    10/10/2022, 08:05

    44.44% Shortened!

    By Dan Coombs Manchester United winger Antony says it is an honour to share the pitch with teammate Cristiano Ronaldo

    Ronaldo scored United’s winning goal at Goodison Park to help the Red Devils to an important 2-1 victory

    The goal was the 700th club goal of Ronaldo’s illustrious career to date, a stunning achievement

    Antony posted on Twitter after the game to congratulate Ronaldo on his milestone goal

    Ronaldo has 144 club goals for United, and so Antony has a long way to go to catch him up

    ['united', 'antony', 'ronaldo', 'goal', 'club']
