  • 'LEGITIMACY OF GOVT INTACT'

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/10/legitimacy-of-govt-intact

    10/10/2022, 08:05

    47.62% Shortened!

    Monday, 10 Oct 2022

    Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob said any loss of confidence on the prime minister, as stipulated under the Federal Constitution, was only when MPs retracted their support for him

    “Then the government will collapse as what happened to Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin, and the government will change

    That was why all in the last Cabinet had to step down

    He reiterated that what was paramount was the support he enjoyed from the majority of MPs in the Dewan Rakyat, which was the basis of him remaining as the Prime Minister

    “However, the power of dissolution is a matter between the prime minister and Yang di-Pertuan Agong

    “The letter had no effect on the legitimacy of the government or the prime minister, as the (majority of) MPs are still in support of the Prime Minister,” he told reporters after attending the National Maulidur Rasul celebration at the World Trade Centre Kuala Lumpur here yesterday

    The Cabinet can still function and the government will still be functional,” he added

    PAS deputy president Datuk Seri Tuan Ibrahim Tuan Man, who is Environment and Water Minister, revealed that the letter was sent after a meeting of all Perikatan component parties

    Meanwhile, Ismail Sabri is said to have had another audience with the Yang di-Pertuan Agong yesterday following his meeting with the King on Thursday

    The King and Queen are due to leave for London on a week-long visit

    ['government', 'letter', 'king', 'minister', 'say']

    Monday, 10 Oct 2022

    Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob said any loss of confidence on the prime minister, as stipulated under the Federal Constitution, was only when MPs retracted their support for him

    “Then the government will collapse as what happened to Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin, and the government will change

    That was why all in the last Cabinet had to step down

    He reiterated that what was paramount was the support he enjoyed from the majority of MPs in the Dewan Rakyat, which was the basis of him remaining as the Prime Minister

    “However, the power of dissolution is a matter between the prime minister and Yang di-Pertuan Agong

    “The letter had no effect on the legitimacy of the government or the prime minister, as the (majority of) MPs are still in support of the Prime Minister,” he told reporters after attending the National Maulidur Rasul celebration at the World Trade Centre Kuala Lumpur here yesterday

    The Cabinet can still function and the government will still be functional,” he added

    PAS deputy president Datuk Seri Tuan Ibrahim Tuan Man, who is Environment and Water Minister, revealed that the letter was sent after a meeting of all Perikatan component parties

    Meanwhile, Ismail Sabri is said to have had another audience with the Yang di-Pertuan Agong yesterday following his meeting with the King on Thursday

    The King and Queen are due to leave for London on a week-long visit

    ['government', 'letter', 'king', 'minister', 'say']



  • 'RELEASE BKM AID PROMPTLY'

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/10/release-bkm-aid-promptly

    10/10/2022, 08:05

    53.85% Shortened!

    Jayenthi and Normah hope the money will help ease constraints

    Jayenthi, 53, and her eldest daughter, a single mother of three young children, said that “red tape” previously prevented them from getting the full benefits of BKM

    Jayenthi said she lost her husband to a freak accident last year and had received RM200 from the government to date

    Rajamah, 34, was also appealing for assistance to help raise her children, who are four, nine and 11

    “Life has been difficult since my husband, a lorry driver, died last year

    Kitchen helper Jeannie Goh, 53, welcomed the increase in aid for single parents, especially since the cost of living has spiked significantly since the middle of this year

    “I have yet to receive the allocation under BKM last year, and I hope this does not repeat next year,” said the mother of three

    She said she would use most of the money on her eldest daughter, who is currently studying at a public university

    Single mother Normah Pardi, 45, also said she was grateful for the assistance, which would ease her financial burden

    “Hopefully, the extra income through BKM will ease some of my financial constraints,” she added

    Aside from that, single in- dividuals and single senior citizens will also continue to receive cash allowances of between RM350 and RM600, depending on their income.

    Kindly fill the form below We hope you enjoy this feature!

    ['hope', 'bkm', 'assistance', 'single', 'child']

    Jayenthi and Normah hope the money will help ease constraints

    Jayenthi, 53, and her eldest daughter, a single mother of three young children, said that “red tape” previously prevented them from getting the full benefits of BKM

    Jayenthi said she lost her husband to a freak accident last year and had received RM200 from the government to date

    Rajamah, 34, was also appealing for assistance to help raise her children, who are four, nine and 11

    “Life has been difficult since my husband, a lorry driver, died last year

    Kitchen helper Jeannie Goh, 53, welcomed the increase in aid for single parents, especially since the cost of living has spiked significantly since the middle of this year

    “I have yet to receive the allocation under BKM last year, and I hope this does not repeat next year,” said the mother of three

    She said she would use most of the money on her eldest daughter, who is currently studying at a public university

    Single mother Normah Pardi, 45, also said she was grateful for the assistance, which would ease her financial burden

    “Hopefully, the extra income through BKM will ease some of my financial constraints,” she added

    Aside from that, single in- dividuals and single senior citizens will also continue to receive cash allowances of between RM350 and RM600, depending on their income.

  • WHY CASEMIRO IS UNITED'S MIDFIELD GENERAL

    https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/casemiro-performance-against-everton-shows-what-the-brazilian-will-bring-to-man-utd

    10/10/2022

    52.17% Shortened!

    When Erik ten Hag’s starting XI was revealed for Manchester United’s clash away at Everton on Sunday evening, Casemiro’s first Premier League start as a Red was confirmed

    Casemiro is still adjusting to English football, but the signs from his first Premier League start are promising… THE SIGNS ARE THERE The majority of Casemiro’s play against the Toffees highlighted what an asset he will become for the Reds this season

    Battling for possession, and also having eye for a pass, the Brazilian demonstrated just why Ten Hag brought him to Old Trafford in the summer

    Of course, as is expected of a player still adapting to life in the Premier League, there were a couple of rogue passes and lapses in concentration, but Casemiro dealt with the pressure well

    None of Casemiro’s balls were more impressive than his assist, though, when the Brazilian regained possession well in the centre of the park before splitting the Everton defence with one through ball to the feet of Cristiano Ronaldo

    Ronaldo's 700th goal in club football proved our match-winner, but don't overlook Casemiro's quality assist..

    It’s safe to say Casemiro hasn’t disappointed

    90 in 20 | The extended highlights of our Premier League match at Goodison Park are now available to watch..

    PRAISE FROM THE BOSS After the game, Ten Hag was asked about Casemiro’s impact so far

    “[It was] a good ball in, a good pass to Cristiano and a good finish.”   The boss explains what pleased him about United’s performance at Goodison Park

    See what our players said about the victory at Everton and Cristiano Ronaldo's 700th club goal

  • KING ORDERS FULL FLOOD PREPARATIONS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/10/king-orders-full-flood-preparations

    10/10/2022, 07:35

    56.0% Shortened!

    Yang di-Pertuan Agong Al-Sultan Abdullah Ri’ayatuddin Al-Mustafa Billah Shah also urged the bodies involved to ensure that assistance reached flood victims effectively and quickly in a systematic manner

    “I also asked all relevant agencies to make detailed and comprehensive preparations to cater for the people’s well-being

    “The preparations must not only be in mitigating the effects of floods, but also in devising a system to ensure that assistance reaches the flood victims in a planned manner quickly and effectively,” the King said

    His Majesty also called on leaders to emulate Prophet Muhammad’s leadership

    “Therefore, everything that is done by a leader should be done for the good of the community

    This is why the Prophet insisted on a tight-knit relationship between the leader and his community based on love and respect

    “As the Prophet said, the best among your leaders are those whom you love and they love you; whom you pray for and they pray for you; and the worst of the leaders are those whom you hate and they hate you,” Sultan Abdullah said

    His Majesty also stated that the non-discriminatory policies for all religions in the Medina Charter, which was used to govern by the Prophet, ensured a united nation under his leadership, six decades before the Magna Carta itself

    (Issued in June 1215, the Magna Carta was the first document to put into writing the principle that the King of England and his government were not above the law.) At the same event, Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department (Religious Affairs) Datuk Idris Ahmad said it was vital for a Muslim-majority country to practise the concept of welfare and non-discriminatory policies for everyone

    “As a country with Muslims as its majority, the multiracial and multi- religious community has to understand that Islam celebrates diversity and plurality of a community, a Malaysian asset

    “The success of Prophet Muhammad as an excellent statesman must be exemplified, especially his leadership in the administration of a diverse community,” he said.

    ['flood', 'also', 'say', 'prophet', 'leader']

    Yang di-Pertuan Agong Al-Sultan Abdullah Ri’ayatuddin Al-Mustafa Billah Shah also urged the bodies involved to ensure that assistance reached flood victims effectively and quickly in a systematic manner

    “I also asked all relevant agencies to make detailed and comprehensive preparations to cater for the people’s well-being

    “The preparations must not only be in mitigating the effects of floods, but also in devising a system to ensure that assistance reaches the flood victims in a planned manner quickly and effectively,” the King said

    His Majesty also called on leaders to emulate Prophet Muhammad’s leadership

    “Therefore, everything that is done by a leader should be done for the good of the community

    This is why the Prophet insisted on a tight-knit relationship between the leader and his community based on love and respect

    “As the Prophet said, the best among your leaders are those whom you love and they love you; whom you pray for and they pray for you; and the worst of the leaders are those whom you hate and they hate you,” Sultan Abdullah said

    His Majesty also stated that the non-discriminatory policies for all religions in the Medina Charter, which was used to govern by the Prophet, ensured a united nation under his leadership, six decades before the Magna Carta itself

    (Issued in June 1215, the Magna Carta was the first document to put into writing the principle that the King of England and his government were not above the law.) At the same event, Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department (Religious Affairs) Datuk Idris Ahmad said it was vital for a Muslim-majority country to practise the concept of welfare and non-discriminatory policies for everyone

    “As a country with Muslims as its majority, the multiracial and multi- religious community has to understand that Islam celebrates diversity and plurality of a community, a Malaysian asset

    “The success of Prophet Muhammad as an excellent statesman must be exemplified, especially his leadership in the administration of a diverse community,” he said.

    ['flood', 'also', 'say', 'prophet', 'leader']



  • DISSOLUTION CAN GO AHEAD IN KING'S ABSENCE WITH CONSENT

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/10/dissolution-can-go-ahead-in-kings-absence-with-consent

    10/10/2022, 07:35

    42.11% Shortened!

    The big question is whether Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob can announce the dissolution of Parliament with the King not being in the country

    Talk is that Ismail Sabri has received the King’s formal consent to dissolve Parliament and that the Prime Minister has relayed this to Umno president Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi

    “If the King has consented to the dissolution of Parliament with a date fixed and if this has already been gazetted, the dissolution can take place even if the Yang di-Pertuan Agong is not in the country,’’ he said

    Dr Shad Saleem said three elements – the King’s formal consent, a fixed date and gazetting of the dissolution – must be fulfilled

    He said these formalities must be strictly adhered to as the dissolution of Parliament was a crucial event which will see “222 MPs losing their jobs” and the Election Commission getting into action to set a date for nomination and polling

    Lawyer and activist Nizam Bashir Abdul Kariem Bashir echoed the view, adding that once consent to dissolve Parliament had been made, the Federal Constitution provides no restrictions as to where the Yang di-Pertuan Agong must be

    Political observers urged Ismail Sabri to announce Parliament’s dissolution as soon as possible if it was indeed true that the King had already given the green light

    “We don’t know how foreign direct investments will react if the dissolution of Parliament is left hanging and the general election is delayed,’’ said political analyst Prof Dr Sivamurugan Pandian

    He said indications of Parliament being close to dissolution were clearly evident

    “The Umno top five have met and the Prime Minister has also had an audience with the Yang di-Pertuan Agong,’’ he said, adding the early tabling of Budget 2023 was also an indicator

    Academic Prof Datuk Dr Ramlah Adam said putting up with an unstable political situation was not good for the country

    ['dissolution', 'parliament', 'yang', 'pertuan', 'agong']

    The big question is whether Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob can announce the dissolution of Parliament with the King not being in the country

    Talk is that Ismail Sabri has received the King’s formal consent to dissolve Parliament and that the Prime Minister has relayed this to Umno president Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi

    “If the King has consented to the dissolution of Parliament with a date fixed and if this has already been gazetted, the dissolution can take place even if the Yang di-Pertuan Agong is not in the country,’’ he said

    Dr Shad Saleem said three elements – the King’s formal consent, a fixed date and gazetting of the dissolution – must be fulfilled

    He said these formalities must be strictly adhered to as the dissolution of Parliament was a crucial event which will see “222 MPs losing their jobs” and the Election Commission getting into action to set a date for nomination and polling

    Lawyer and activist Nizam Bashir Abdul Kariem Bashir echoed the view, adding that once consent to dissolve Parliament had been made, the Federal Constitution provides no restrictions as to where the Yang di-Pertuan Agong must be

    Political observers urged Ismail Sabri to announce Parliament’s dissolution as soon as possible if it was indeed true that the King had already given the green light

    “We don’t know how foreign direct investments will react if the dissolution of Parliament is left hanging and the general election is delayed,’’ said political analyst Prof Dr Sivamurugan Pandian

    He said indications of Parliament being close to dissolution were clearly evident

    “The Umno top five have met and the Prime Minister has also had an audience with the Yang di-Pertuan Agong,’’ he said, adding the early tabling of Budget 2023 was also an indicator

    Academic Prof Datuk Dr Ramlah Adam said putting up with an unstable political situation was not good for the country

    ['dissolution', 'parliament', 'yang', 'pertuan', 'agong']

  • DAVID DE GEA WANTS TO STAY AT MANCHESTER UNITED DESPITE TORRID PERFORMANCES THIS SEASON

    https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-11297615/David-Gea-wants-stay-Manchester-United-despite-torrid-performances-season.html

    10/10/2022, 07:05

    47.62% Shortened!

    The 31-year-old produced an acrobatic late stop to deny Amadou Onana and preserve a 2-1 win at Everton on Sunday night

    Man United are yet to decide on De Gea's future at Old Trafford, with the club considering triggering a one-year extension on his current deal

    'I am very focused on helping the team, of course I would like to be here more years but let’s see what happens in the future.' The Spanish goalkeeper's current United deal is up at the end of the season, and there have been reports he doesn't suit Erik ten Hag's proactive style

    The 31-year-old goalkeeper helped preserve a 2-1 win at Everton on Sunday night United this month announced wage bill increases of £61.6million on the previous year - a 19.1% rise - as a result of high profile acquisitions, and De Gea's current deal earned him around £350,000-a-week last season

    During his 11-year stay at Old Trafford, the Spanish goalkeeper has played his way to the top of the pile in the United dressing room, and is the only remaining player from the club's last title-winning squad to regularly play

    During his 11-year stay at Old Trafford, the Spanish goalkeeper has played his way to the top of the pile in the United dressing room, and is the only remaining player from the club's last title-winning squad to regularly play

    By posting your comment you agree to our house rules

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual We will automatically post your comment and a link to the news story to your Facebook timeline at the same time it is posted on MailOnline

    To do this we will link your MailOnline account with your Facebook account

    We’ll ask you to confirm this for your first post to Facebook

    You can choose on each post whether you would like it to be posted to Facebook

    ['mailonline', 'comment', 'united', 'year', 'post']



  • LIVERPOOL PROVE VIRGIL VAN DIJK WRONG AS DARWIN NÚÑEZ OFFERS BIG HOPE FOR JÜRGEN KLOPP

    https://www.liverpool.com/liverpool-fc-news/features/liverpool-van-dijk-darwin-nunez-25217251

    10/10/2022, 07:05

    54.17% Shortened!

    Sign up to receive the best LFC opinion direct to your inbox We have more newsletters Liverpool were left with plenty more problems to solve as they dropped points for the sixth time in eight Premier League matches, with Jürgen Klopp needing to come up with some fixes all over the field very quickly

    Here are the three moments Liverpool.com picked out from another chastening defeat, this time at the hands of table-topping Arsenal at the Emirates Stadium

    It was just a shame that those behind him could not make the strike mean more as the easy manner of the Arsenal goals left plenty to work on

    If you enjoyed this piece, you'll love our latest project here on Liverpool.com — our new-look, exclusive newsletter, which is sent each weekday only to people signed up for our mailing list

    Our newsletter subscribers get a rundown Monday to Friday from one of the best Liverpool FC writers — straight to your inbox, and completely for free

    The Ugly Liverpool were left wide open on the attack once more, with their midfield double pivot working nicely for a while — and then disappearing as if they were not on the field

    Arsenal got themselves 2-1 in front when Liverpool had dominated for 20 minutes or more

    "People will look at our Premier League form and think we’ve got no chance at Arsenal on Sunday

    This was confirmation that the Scottish side were not the greatest of challenges and that against a better team, Liverpool still have some work to do

    People might have made out that Liverpool had no chance against Arsenal

    Liverpool are indeed capable of much better, but they proved Van Dijk wrong and got exactly what they deserved here.

  • EVERTON VS. MANCHESTER UNITED - FOOTBALL MATCH REPORT - OCTOBER 9, 2022

    https://www.espn.com/soccer/report/_/gameId/637918

    10/10/2022, 05:05

    54.17% Shortened!

    Rob Dawson talks about Cristiano Ronaldo after the Manchester United striker scores his 700th career club goal

    Ronaldo, 37, scored his 700th club career goal to give United the lead after Antony had equalised from Alex Iwobi's early opener

    "I am really happy because he has been working hard to get this goal

    The Brazilian shifted onto his favoured left foot and fired past Jordan Pickford to score his third goal in as many matches for United since signing from Ajax

    And it was the substitute Ronaldo who gave United the lead, scoring his 700th club goal a minute before the end of the first half

    - Ronaldo proves himself in much-needed United win The Portuguese striker burst down the left flank and showed his goalscoring pedigree with a clinical low, left-footed strike past Pickford

    "United had good possession and moved the ball well

    There's a lot I can reflect on in the game but when you look at it in the cold light of day it was two of our mistakes that led to goals." United's victory moved them up to fifth in the Premier League table

    The Premier League title race is almost a quarter of the way through

    It's still early, but how will things pan for the Big Six in the months ahead? Sunday's 3-2 loss at Arsenal left Liverpool 10th in the Premier League table, and the numbers from their season so far make for grim reading

    Nedum Onuoha and Julien Laurens debate whether Arsenal can win the Premier League title

    ['ronaldo', 'united', 'goal', 'premier', 'league']

  • MAN UTD WINNERS AND LOSES VS EVERTON AS CRISTIANO RONALDO STRIKES TO DEAL JADON SANCHO BLOW

    https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/winners-losers-man-utd-ronaldo-28193954

    10/10/2022, 04:03

    67.65% Shortened!

    Cristiano Ronaldo struck his 700th club career goal as Manchester United ran out deserved winners over Everton with Antony also finding the net for the Red Devils Manchester United returned to winning ways in the Premier League by coming from behind to beat Everton 2-1 on Sunday evening

    United took control of proceedings, and the lead, just before half-time through Cristiano Ronaldo, who ran in behind before slotting home for his 700th career goal

    Cristiano Ronaldo It has been a frustrating start to the season for Ronaldo, who has struggled for form and has subsequently dropped out of the Premier League XI since that 4-0 defeat Brentford

    It could prove to be a massive moment in Ronaldo's United season, with the 37-year-old previously under pressure

    But the 22-year-old responded finely to those comments by becoming the first United player to score in each of his first three Premier League appearances

    Christian Eriksen Although he didn't provide a goal or an assist in United's win over Everton, Eriksen ran the show in midfield and further demonstrated why Ten Hag decided to sign him in the summer

    Anthony Martial Martial was handed his first start of the season after impressing from the bench against Manchester City and Omonia Nicosia, replacing Jadon Sancho in the starting XI

    He was replaced by Ronaldo, who went onto score and show Ten Hag why he should be in the side more often

    Although Martial did provide the assist for Antony's leveller, Ronaldo's strike and his overall performance could dent Martial's chances of playing more when he is back fit

    Shaw was one of United’s best performers on the pitch and showed why Ten Hag was right to recall him to the starting XI in the Premier League for the first time since the defeat at Brentford on August 13

    Read more Can United mount a title challenge? Get our FREE daily Manchester United email newsletter

    ['ronaldo', 'united', 'antony', 'ten', 'hag']

  • TIEN-CHEN AND JIN WEI HELP AMPANG JAYA BC WIN MAIDEN PURPLE LEAGUE TITLE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/sport/badminton/2022/10/10/stars-of-the-show

    10/10/2022

    56.0% Shortened!

    But they went all the way to capture their maiden title after a stunning 9-2 victory over 2017 champions Petaling Badminton Club in the final yesterday at the Arena of Stars in Genting Highlands

    Tien-chen rebounded strongly from a shock loss to Puchong United Badminton Club’s Lee Cheuk Yiu in the semi-finals by defeating Petaling BC’s Brice Leverdez 11-10, 11-5, 9-11, 11-6 to give his team the perfect start

    It was then left to Indonesians Sabar Gutama-Moh Reza Pahlevi to seal the tie and the crown for Ampang Jaya BC and they delivered with a composed 11-9, 11-4, 11-6 win over Goh V Shem-Low Juan Shen

    Sabar and Moh were delighted to give their team the winning point

    “This is my first Purple League and I feel so happy that Sabar and I managed to help Ampang Jaya BC win the title

    I hope that we can win again next year

    So, I’m so happy to nick it this time.” Ampang Jaya BC team manager Voon Siaw Yie was happy that the team went beyond her expectations

    We do have a very strong team and I believe this helped us to win

    Meanwhile, Puchong United Badminton Club finished third after beating Sena Bangkok Club 10-5 in the third-place playoff and collected RM60,000 while the latter received RM50,000

    Ampang Jaya Badminton Club

    Senheng RedOne Purple League Professional

    ['ampang', 'jaya', 'badminton', 'club', 'win']

  • ROBERTO FIRMINO SENDS CLEAR LIVERPOOL AND FSG MESSAGE AS NEW JÜRGEN KLOPP PRIORITY IS CLEAR

    https://www.liverpool.com/liverpool-fc-news/features/liverpool-roberto-firmino-klopp-fsg-25218524

    10/10/2022

    45.0% Shortened!

    Jürgen Klopp has a new priority after Liverpool's defeat to Arsenal

    Sign up to receive the best LFC opinion direct to your inbox We have more newsletters It was at the Emirates, perhaps, that things finally crystallised for Liverpool after yet another defeat in what has been a haunting season so far

    It may be a long season to go, but Liverpool will need something extraordinary to overturn the club's current position so drastically on the table

    As Diogo Jota went another game without a goal for Liverpool — his 19th without hitting the back of the net in the crimson red shirt — Firmino has prospered

    The Brazilian has aged like fine wine this season, and he is currently in his best form for some time

    With nine goal contributions in 11 games averaging way more than one goal contribution per every 90 minutes (1.28 per 90 to be precise) the Liverpool forward is the most productive player at the club this season

    Our newsletter subscribers get a rundown Monday to Friday from one of the best Liverpool FC writers — straight to your inbox, and completely for free

    Sign up to the Liverpool.com newsletter here — it only takes a few seconds! Yet his future still hangs on a fine balance

    Liverpool have already felt the impact of Sadio Mané's absence and with the rest of the frontline having fired mostly blanks at goal this season, questions must be raised how Liverpool would cope if they had to part ways with another one of their attacking stars

    Undoubtedly, a successor would have to be brought in, but that successor wouldn't be cheap, and with Liverpool already in need of several midfielders to bolster the club's depth in that department, FSG will be left with a tricky and potentially decisive choice

    If Firmino continues to score there will only be one solution to that dilemma

    ['klopp', 'liverpool', 'firmino', 'sign', 'newsletter']

  • TI11 SCHEDULE, RESULTS, TEAMS, WHERE TO WATCH

    https://www.oneesports.gg/dota2/ti11-schedule-results-teams-streams/

    10/10/2022

    57.69% Shortened!

    Everything in one place

    Singapore plays host to The International 2022, the biggest Dota 2 event of the year

    TI11 is the culmination of the 2021-2022 Dota Pro Circuit, the capstone event for 20 of the world’s best Dota 2 teams

    With millions of dollars and glory on the line, only one team will lay claim to the Aegis, the pinnacle of a pro player’s career

    The TI11 group stage runs from October 15 to 18

    The TI11 playoffs run from October 20 to October 23

    After a six-day break, the last four teams will reconvene on October 29 and 30 for the last two days of TI11

    The top four teams will proceed to the upper bracket, the next four teams to the lower bracket

    The lower bracket kicks off with a best-of-one

    The prize pool currently sits at just over US$13 million at the time of writing, according to the Dota 2 Prize Pool Tracker

    In a first for TI, the group stage will be run entirely by PGL, according to their press release on August 29

    ['one', 'dota', 'ti11', 'best', 'team']

    Everything in one place

    Singapore plays host to The International 2022, the biggest Dota 2 event of the year

    TI11 is the culmination of the 2021-2022 Dota Pro Circuit, the capstone event for 20 of the world’s best Dota 2 teams

    With millions of dollars and glory on the line, only one team will lay claim to the Aegis, the pinnacle of a pro player’s career

    The TI11 group stage runs from October 15 to 18

    The TI11 playoffs run from October 20 to October 23

    After a six-day break, the last four teams will reconvene on October 29 and 30 for the last two days of TI11

    The top four teams will proceed to the upper bracket, the next four teams to the lower bracket

    The lower bracket kicks off with a best-of-one

    The prize pool currently sits at just over US$13 million at the time of writing, according to the Dota 2 Prize Pool Tracker

    In a first for TI, the group stage will be run entirely by PGL, according to their press release on August 29

  • ARSENAL LEAVE LIVERPOOL'S TITLE HOPES IN TATTERS DORTMUND KEEP THEIRS ALIVE - WEEKEND REVIEW

    https://www.espn.co.uk/football/english-premier-league/story/4764669/arsenal-leave-liverpools-title-hopes-in-tatters-dortmund-keep-theirs-alive-weekend-review

    10/10/2022

    82.54% Shortened!

    From Borussia Dortmund's dramatic 2-2 draw with Bayern Munich, to Liverpool dropping even further back in the Premier League title race, there was no shortage of drama

    If Martial can't stay injury-free, Ronaldo's move away will have to wait until at least the end of the season -- Dawson Rob Dawson talks about Cristiano Ronaldo after the Manchester United striker scores his 700th career club goal

    Are Liverpool out of the title race already? The Premier League season is not even 25% played, but Liverpool's hopes of a second title under Jurgen Klopp already look remote

    Sevilla were in a title race last season and always finished in the top four under Lopetegui, but this weekend's draw saw them slip into the bottom three

    It has been a miserable season for them despite the quality of the squad

    His first game next weekend, away at sixth place Rennes, will be tough

    Finishing in the top three, which is where Lyon should be and aim to be, will be even harder

    You won't see a better goal this weekend and not many this season either

    To score it straight after half-time to give his team a two-goal lead was huge as well

    Ter Stegen made a string of late saves as Barca clung on to a 1-0 win at Camp Nou, which took them back to the top of the league going into next weekend's Clasico against Real Madrid

    Ter Stegen has now kept seven clean sheets in eight league games this season, conceding just one goal in that time

  • LIVERPOOL ANALYSIS - LUIS DIAZ AND MOHAMED SALAH SUFFER AS OPPORTUNITY ARISES IN DEFENCE

    https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/mohamed-salah-liverpool-analysis-breaking-25219075

    10/10/2022

    50.0% Shortened!

    Liverpool analysis after defeat at Arsenal as Luis Diaz is injured and Mohamed Salah struggles Follow the latest transfer news and more with our LFC newsletter We have more newsletters Diaz and Salah suffer It was a grim afternoon for Liverpool’s wide players at the Emirates

    Until being booted out of the game by clumsy Arsenal midfielder Thomas Partey, Luis Diaz had been, like in so many recent outings, the Reds’ most dangerous forward

    That he was sat on the touchline as Liverpool chased in vain for a third equaliser spoke volumes

    Gomez opportunity knocks Any reminder of the Roy Hodgson era is enough to send a shiver down the spine of any Liverpool supporter who endured that dark period

    That, though, isn’t sufficient to explain the brittle nature of Liverpool’s performances away from Anfield this season, the defence again too easily prised apart

    Joe Gomez would not have wanted to make his 150th Liverpool appearance at the expense of the crocked Trent Alexander-Arnold, but there could now be an opening for him at right-back if his team-mate is sidelined for a period

    But at least Klopp now has options

    Bobby dazzles - briefly So continues Roberto Firmino’s Liverpool farewell tour

    On for the stricken Diaz, Firmino just took 11 minutes to impressively slot home Liverpool’s second equaliser, his 10th in the league against Arsenal – more than any other player in the Reds' history

    And with Nunez producing another encouraging all-round performance to go with his strike, there cannot be too many quibbles with Liverpool’s goal threat – even if their collective defending leaves much to be desired

    Klopp needs to find the right balance – and quickly

    ['liverpool', 'arsenal', 'diaz', 'salah', 'red']

  • TOUR DE LANGKAWI BACK WITH A BANG – PREVIEW

    https://www.cyclingnews.com/races/le-tour-de-langkawi-2022/preview/

    10/10/2022

    66.67% Shortened!

    The continued pursuit of options other than cancellation, however, means that as well as being one of the last events in the region to run before the pandemic, it will be one of the first to return.  China’s WorldTour ranked Tour of Guangxi, which was due to finish off the top-tier season, was cancelled again this year

    Whether it’s the time slot, an enthusiasm to return to the region after a period of absence, or the intensity of the relegation battle, it's a bumper crop of top-tier teams on the start list for the Tour de Langkawi this year

    UAE Team Emirates, Cofidis, Lotto Soudal, EF Education-EasyPost and Movistar will be lining up at the race for the first time, while Astana-Qazaqstan are returning

    Instead, it will be an all-out battle for stage, category and overall glory

    Perhaps he will be looking for some alternate cooling methods in the heat of Malaysia as he takes on the Tour de Langkawi for the first time

    It may be called the Tour of Langkawi but while the island off northwestern Malaysia may be the eponymous endpoint, this is one of those occasions where it is as much about the journey as the destination.  After flying into Kuala Lumpur, the riders will spend the first three stages within reach of the nation’s capital before the stages stretch out towards the north and then transfer over to Langkawi, known as the Jewel of Kedah, for the last two stages.  The initial stages aren’t without their challenges, with the 157.3 km opening day from Kuala Pilah including 5 categorised climbs – all category 2 and 3 – before the race charges down from Look Out Point for an expected sprint in front of the Petronas Twin Tower in the centre of Kuala Lumpur.  Two category 3 climbs await on the flatter stage 2 but it is the longest stage of the race at 178.9km.  Then there is stage 3, which is set to be a make or break point for overall challengers

    The 131.9km stage from Putrajaya to the Genting Highlands has a history of proving pivotal

    Riders will face two category 2 climbs, one of them the familiar Look Out Point from near the end of stage 1, as they skirt past Kuala Lumpur and toward the final battle of the day.  Riders will face the dual challenge of the HC climbs of Gohtong Jaya and Genting Highlands in quick succession with the Gohtong Jaya KOM just 20km before the finish line

    The race is likely to also deliver more opportunity for a bunch sprint over the next two stages – stage 5 from Kuala Kangsar to Kulim and stage 6 from Georgetown to Alor Setar – as the race heads north and ever closer to its Langkawi finale.

    The first stage on Langkawi from Kuah to Gunung Raya may be the shortest of the race at 90.8km but it is not without its challenges and is the most likely stage, after the Genting Highlands, to sway the GC

    The final stage on Tuesday October 18 loops its way around the island on the Kuah Langkawi loop to deliver 115.9km and a finale for the sprinters

    ['race', 'team', 'tour', 'langkawi', 'rider']

    The continued pursuit of options other than cancellation, however, means that as well as being one of the last events in the region to run before the pandemic, it will be one of the first to return.  China’s WorldTour ranked Tour of Guangxi, which was due to finish off the top-tier season, was cancelled again this year

    Whether it’s the time slot, an enthusiasm to return to the region after a period of absence, or the intensity of the relegation battle, it's a bumper crop of top-tier teams on the start list for the Tour de Langkawi this year

    UAE Team Emirates, Cofidis, Lotto Soudal, EF Education-EasyPost and Movistar will be lining up at the race for the first time, while Astana-Qazaqstan are returning

    Instead, it will be an all-out battle for stage, category and overall glory

    Perhaps he will be looking for some alternate cooling methods in the heat of Malaysia as he takes on the Tour de Langkawi for the first time

    It may be called the Tour of Langkawi but while the island off northwestern Malaysia may be the eponymous endpoint, this is one of those occasions where it is as much about the journey as the destination.  After flying into Kuala Lumpur, the riders will spend the first three stages within reach of the nation’s capital before the stages stretch out towards the north and then transfer over to Langkawi, known as the Jewel of Kedah, for the last two stages.  The initial stages aren’t without their challenges, with the 157.3 km opening day from Kuala Pilah including 5 categorised climbs – all category 2 and 3 – before the race charges down from Look Out Point for an expected sprint in front of the Petronas Twin Tower in the centre of Kuala Lumpur.  Two category 3 climbs await on the flatter stage 2 but it is the longest stage of the race at 178.9km.  Then there is stage 3, which is set to be a make or break point for overall challengers

    The 131.9km stage from Putrajaya to the Genting Highlands has a history of proving pivotal

    Riders will face two category 2 climbs, one of them the familiar Look Out Point from near the end of stage 1, as they skirt past Kuala Lumpur and toward the final battle of the day.  Riders will face the dual challenge of the HC climbs of Gohtong Jaya and Genting Highlands in quick succession with the Gohtong Jaya KOM just 20km before the finish line

    The race is likely to also deliver more opportunity for a bunch sprint over the next two stages – stage 5 from Kuala Kangsar to Kulim and stage 6 from Georgetown to Alor Setar – as the race heads north and ever closer to its Langkawi finale.

    The first stage on Langkawi from Kuah to Gunung Raya may be the shortest of the race at 90.8km but it is not without its challenges and is the most likely stage, after the Genting Highlands, to sway the GC

    The final stage on Tuesday October 18 loops its way around the island on the Kuah Langkawi loop to deliver 115.9km and a finale for the sprinters

    ['race', 'team', 'tour', 'langkawi', 'rider']



  • PETRONAS DECLARES FORCE MAJEURE ON MALAYSIAN LNG EXPORTS

    https://www.upstreamonline.com/lng/petronas-declares-force-majeure-on-malaysian-lng-exports/2-1-1331014?zephr_sso_ott=C1i4jX

    10/10/2022

    60.71% Shortened!

    Pipeline leak has an impact on volumes to customers Petronas has declared force majeure on gas supplies to MLNG Dua — one of four liquefaction projects at the Petronas LNG Complex in Bintulu, Sarawak – following a pipeline leak which has left the Malaysian energy giant scrambling to find volumes for some of its customers

    Force majeure was declared on MLNG Dua (MLNG 2) on 21 September after subsidence issues on a section of the Sabah-Sarawak Gas Pipeline (SSGP) denominated as KP201

    The SSGP pipeline delivers feedstock gas to the liquefaction facility

    The company gave no suggestion as to when the pipeline might be repaired and when force majeure might be lifted from the three-train MLNG Dua complex, which has nameplate liquefaction capacity of 9.6 million tonnes per annum of LNG

    Petronas added that it wants to clarify that the force majeure is affecting the supply of gas to MLNG Dua’s production facility only

    The other LNG production facilities — MLNG, MLNG Tiga and Train 9 — within its LNG Complex continue to operate as planned

    Petronas holds an 80% operated stake in MLNG Dua

    Upstream is part of NHST Media group

    To read more about NHST Media Group,

    Upstream is part of NHST Media Group AS

    Read more about NHST Media Group here

    ['pipeline', 'petronas', 'gas', 'mlng', 'lng']

    Force majeure was declared on MLNG Dua (MLNG 2) on 21 September after subsidence issues on a section of the Sabah-Sarawak Gas Pipeline (SSGP) denominated as KP201

    The SSGP pipeline delivers feedstock gas to the liquefaction facility

    The company gave no suggestion as to when the pipeline might be repaired and when force majeure might be lifted from the three-train MLNG Dua complex, which has nameplate liquefaction capacity of 9.6 million tonnes per annum of LNG

  • HCK CAPITAL BEING ASKED TO HELP SAVE EMPIRE REMIX 1 IN SUBANG JAYA'S USJ1

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/article/hck-capital-being-asked-help-save-empire-remix-1-subang-jayas-usj1

    10/10/2022

    73.17% Shortened!

    Sources say that in the event HCK Capital, a company controlled by businessman Tan Sri Clement Hii, emerges as a white knight to take over the project, it may have to pump in as much as RM900 million for the construction and infrastructure to complete Empire Remix 1

    The ailing project is located across the road from Empire Remix 2 (which has been renamed Edumetro)

    Both projects were originally launched by True Renaissance Development Sdn Bhd, a unit of Mammoth Empire Holding Sdn Bhd (MEH)

    Less than 30% of Empire Remix 1 had been completed before the project came to a halt

    Dergahayu then took over Empire Remix 1 but failed to complete the development

    At its launch in 2012, Empire Remix 1 had an estimated gross development value (GDV) of RM2.3 billion

    The project has a GDV of RM850 million

    When contacted, an HCK Capital spokesman tells The Edge, “We have been asked to come in, and will only do so if the project is still feasible

    The creditors here refer to the 2,500 buyers of the Empire Remix 1 project

    The project has already been delayed by five years

    Should HCK Capital step in, Empire Remix 1 is expected to be renamed and will likely be a mixed-use development comprising residential, commercial and retail components

    ['empire', 'remix', 'hck', 'capital', 'project']

  • GE15: 'RECKLESS' PARTIES PUSHING FOR POLL DURING FLOOD SEASON, SAYS ANWAR

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/10/ge15-reckless-parties-pushing-for-poll-during-flood-season-says-anwar

    10/10/2022

    50.0% Shortened!

    Monday, 10 Oct 2022

    However, Anwar said he also accepted the King's decision

    "However, what's in question is the intention of the parties that are so reckless for insisting the election is held at the present time

    Anwar said the flood season has already started in some areas in Sabah, such as Kota Kinabalu, Tuaran and Penampang

    Weather experts also expect heavy rains to continue

    "What kind of people, political parties and governments that are brave and willing to risk the lives and fate of the people by holding elections at this time? "If the elections would put Malaysians at risk and voting would become a challenge for some people, then it is seen as cheating and trying to prevent voters from carrying out their responsibilities," he said, adding that the time has come to correct such fraud and depravity

    Anwar also advised the voters that their choice in the upcoming election would have a great impact on the future of the people and the country

    "Are you worried about the price of goods? Job opportunities? Monsoon and floods? Do you want a quality education? Do you want a fair system and access to health? Then we must vote

    "We have no choice but to continue to be consistent with a clear spirit, courage and commitment in building a resilient and strong Malaysia

    "Malaysia must rise above," he added.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

  • SULU SULTAN'S HEIRS STRIKE AGAIN

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/article/sulu-sultans-heirs-strike-again

    10/10/2022

    66.67% Shortened!

    Attempts to seize Malaysian assets in Holland come after bailiffs acting for the heirs of the Sulu Sultan seized Petronas Azerbaijan (Shah Deniz) Sàrl and Petronas South Caucasus Sàrl in Luxembourg in mid-July

    We might settle this matter very quickly.” Petronas did not respond to questions posed by The Edge

    While putting a value to the companies was difficult, checks by The Edge indicate that Petronas Carigali Canada BV, which is a wholly-owned entity of the national oil company, has a 100% equity interest in Petronas Energy Canada Ltd and Petronas Canada LNG Ltd, which are huge entities

    Petronas Canada LNG has a 72% stake in the North Montney Joint Venture, where its partners include China’s Sinopec Corp (15% stake), Indian Oil Corp (10%) and Petroleum Brunei (3%)

    Petronas Canada LNG was previously known as Progress Energy Canada Ltd, and was acquired at end-2012 for close to US$5.2 billion

    Apart from assets in Canada, a number of Dutch companies controlled by Petronas — Petronas West Papua IV Indonesia BV, Petronas Gebang Indonesia BV, Petronas Aru Indonesia BV, Petronas Andaman III Indonesia BV, Natuna 1 BV, PC Sakakemang BV — control the national oil company’s Indonesian operations

    Petronas Andaman III has a 49% stake in a joint venture with Repsol, PC Sakakemang has 45% equity interest in the Sakakemang production sharing contract (PSC) and Petronas Aru Indonesia owns 40% of the Aru PSC, among others

    Petronas, via PT PLI Indonesia, also has a downstream lubricants business — held via Netherlands-based company PLI (Netherlands) BV

    In April 2019, Petronas, via Dutch-registered Petronas International Power Corp BV, acquired a 100% stake in Amplus Energy Solutions Pte Ltd, a Singapore-headquartered renewable energy outfit

    Petronas’ 51%-owned shipping company MISC Bhd also has several companies in Holland that hold some of its assets

    When the Sulu Sultan’s heirs sought to seize Petronas’ assets in Luxembourg in July, the national oil company said in a press release that its two subsidiaries — Petronas Azerbaijan (Shah Deniz) Sàrl and Petronas South Caucasus Sàrl — were basically shell companies

    ['malaysia', 'sulu', 'sultan', 'company', 'petronas']

    This scenario happens year in and year out

  • WALL STREET IS MISSING THE RISK TO STOCKS IF INFLATION IS BEATEN

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/wall-street-missing-risk-stocks-133306642.html

    45.0% Shortened!

    (Bloomberg) -- The conventional wisdom with stock bulls is that prices will take off when the Federal Reserve wins its fight against inflation

    It can turn negative in the wake of peak inflation when some of a company’s costs remain high but isn’t able to offset them by raising prices because demand has faltered

    While earnings held up surprisingly well throughout the pandemic and powered a number of bear market rallies, a fall in operating leverage could prove to be the final hazard that brings stocks to their eventual lows, according to a team of Morgan Stanley strategists led by Mike Wilson

    Operating leverage, which his team measured by subtracting sales growth from earnings per share growth, is unlikely to stay positive in the coming quarters, according to his team

    And while he’s one of the many sell-side analysts voicing concerns of a margin contraction, consensus estimates are still positive for next year

    Equity analysts expect earnings to increase 5.56% for the first quarter of 2023 versus a 5.48% jump in sales as margins expand

    While explaining his recent S&P 500 price target downgrade, he wrote that “declining CPI combined with sticky wages should lead to a margin contraction.” Wilson’s team has been arguing for months that the ultimate low for stocks will not be determined by the Fed, but by the growth trajectory of earnings

    Global 12-month forward earnings have been revised down every month in the last quarter

    “Inflation especially early in the cycle tends to mean pricing power for companies,” Sonders said

    “Demand is strong and spending is strong

    That’s great news for earnings

    ['stock', 'price', 'inflation', 'earnings', 'margin']

    (Bloomberg) -- The conventional wisdom with stock bulls is that prices will take off when the Federal Reserve wins its fight against inflation

    It can turn negative in the wake of peak inflation when some of a company’s costs remain high but isn’t able to offset them by raising prices because demand has faltered

    While earnings held up surprisingly well throughout the pandemic and powered a number of bear market rallies, a fall in operating leverage could prove to be the final hazard that brings stocks to their eventual lows, according to a team of Morgan Stanley strategists led by Mike Wilson

    Operating leverage, which his team measured by subtracting sales growth from earnings per share growth, is unlikely to stay positive in the coming quarters, according to his team

    And while he’s one of the many sell-side analysts voicing concerns of a margin contraction, consensus estimates are still positive for next year

    Equity analysts expect earnings to increase 5.56% for the first quarter of 2023 versus a 5.48% jump in sales as margins expand

    While explaining his recent S&P 500 price target downgrade, he wrote that “declining CPI combined with sticky wages should lead to a margin contraction.” Wilson’s team has been arguing for months that the ultimate low for stocks will not be determined by the Fed, but by the growth trajectory of earnings

    Global 12-month forward earnings have been revised down every month in the last quarter

    “Inflation especially early in the cycle tends to mean pricing power for companies,” Sonders said

    “Demand is strong and spending is strong

  • BIDEN SAYS HE'LL RELEASE 10 MILLION MORE BARRELS FROM THE DWINDLING 'OIL PIGGY BANK' AFTER OPEC'S PRODUCTION CUTS — BUT THIS IS THE BIG RISK WITH MORE WITHDRAWALS

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/biden-says-hell-release-10-191500094.html

    54.17% Shortened!

    In an effort to counter rising prices at the pump, President Biden plans to plunder the country’s “oil piggy bank.” In November, the Department of Energy will deliver 10 million barrels from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve (SPR) to the market

    The SPR — the world's largest supply of emergency crude oil — was established back in 1975 in case of a severe oil supply crisis or economic disruption

    Biden’s decision comes after the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC+) said it would slash oil production by 2 million barrels a day — putting extra pressure on the global energy supply

    However, even before OPEC+ declared it would be cutting back on oil production, gas prices began inching back up again in late September

    The group says the production cuts are being made due to “the uncertainty that surrounds the global economic and oil market outlooks.” As of Oct

    The press release noted that 10 million barrels of oil would be drained from the SPR and the Secretary of Energy would be exploring other options to increase domestic production

    Since March, the Energy Department has released 160 million barrels of crude oil, or over a quarter of the stockpile — draining the SPR to its lowest levels in four decades

    2021 that it strongly opposed tapping into oil stockpiles to counter gas prices

    The group’s concern was that depleting the emergency reserve could put the U.S

    at risk if the global or domestic oil supply reaches dangerously low levels before the supply can be brought back up

    The IPAA recommends ramping up domestic natural gas and oil production instead, although oil producers are already dealing with supply-chain issues, limited capital and investor pressure to boost returns

    ['price', 'oil', 'supply', 'back', 'opec']

    In an effort to counter rising prices at the pump, President Biden plans to plunder the country’s “oil piggy bank.” In November, the Department of Energy will deliver 10 million barrels from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve (SPR) to the market

    The SPR — the world's largest supply of emergency crude oil — was established back in 1975 in case of a severe oil supply crisis or economic disruption

    Biden’s decision comes after the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC+) said it would slash oil production by 2 million barrels a day — putting extra pressure on the global energy supply

    However, even before OPEC+ declared it would be cutting back on oil production, gas prices began inching back up again in late September

    The group says the production cuts are being made due to “the uncertainty that surrounds the global economic and oil market outlooks.” As of Oct

    The press release noted that 10 million barrels of oil would be drained from the SPR and the Secretary of Energy would be exploring other options to increase domestic production

    Since March, the Energy Department has released 160 million barrels of crude oil, or over a quarter of the stockpile — draining the SPR to its lowest levels in four decades

    2021 that it strongly opposed tapping into oil stockpiles to counter gas prices

    The group’s concern was that depleting the emergency reserve could put the U.S

    at risk if the global or domestic oil supply reaches dangerously low levels before the supply can be brought back up

    The IPAA recommends ramping up domestic natural gas and oil production instead, although oil producers are already dealing with supply-chain issues, limited capital and investor pressure to boost returns

    ['price', 'oil', 'supply', 'back', 'opec']



  • THIS MONTH MAY BE THE TIME TO BUY AN I BOND

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/time-to-buy-an-i-bond-163833631.html

    72.5% Shortened!

    If you buy one between now and the end of October, you’ll earn a composite interest rate of 9.62% for the first six months you hold the bonds

    The new semi-annual rate, which is calculated from a formula based on the CPI index from March through September, is expected to slip to around 6% in early November when the new rate is set

    “For investors who haven't taken advantage of their I bond purchase allotment so far this year, snapping up the bonds with the current 9.6% interest rate is a smart idea,” Christine Benz, Morningstar's director of personal finance, told Yahoo Money

    It combines a fixed rate set when the bond is issued which never changes over its 30-year life, and a variable rate, which is reset twice a year in May and November and is based on the six-month change of the non-seasonally adjusted Consumer Price Index for all Urban Consumers (CPI-U) for all items, including food and energy

    “The I bond inflation rate that will be announced in November will be based on the difference between the CPI-U figures of March and September,” Ken Tumin, founder and editor of DepositAccounts.com, a bank account comparison site, told Yahoo Money

    “We won’t know the September figure until October 13, but based on the figures from March through August, the I bond inflation rate will likely be close to 6%.” While the composite rate could fall to zero, it’s guaranteed not to fall below that — so you’ll definitely get your initial investment back when you redeem the bond

    In general, you can only purchase up to $10,000 in I bonds each calendar year

    You might be able to completely or partially exclude savings bond interest from federal income tax when you pay qualified higher education expenses at an eligible institution or state tuition plan, in the same calendar year you redeem eligible I bonds

    “Even though they're one of the safest investments around, you need to hold them for at least a year and you'll forfeit a quarter's worth of interest if you redeem an I bond before five years,” Benz said

    in Naples, Fl., told Yahoo Money

    You and your spouse can each buy up to an additional $10,000 of I bonds for each one

    ['inflation', 'bond', 'buy', 'rate', 'purchase']

    If you buy one between now and the end of October, you’ll earn a composite interest rate of 9.62% for the first six months you hold the bonds

    The new semi-annual rate, which is calculated from a formula based on the CPI index from March through September, is expected to slip to around 6% in early November when the new rate is set

    “For investors who haven't taken advantage of their I bond purchase allotment so far this year, snapping up the bonds with the current 9.6% interest rate is a smart idea,” Christine Benz, Morningstar's director of personal finance, told Yahoo Money

    It combines a fixed rate set when the bond is issued which never changes over its 30-year life, and a variable rate, which is reset twice a year in May and November and is based on the six-month change of the non-seasonally adjusted Consumer Price Index for all Urban Consumers (CPI-U) for all items, including food and energy

    “The I bond inflation rate that will be announced in November will be based on the difference between the CPI-U figures of March and September,” Ken Tumin, founder and editor of DepositAccounts.com, a bank account comparison site, told Yahoo Money

    “We won’t know the September figure until October 13, but based on the figures from March through August, the I bond inflation rate will likely be close to 6%.” While the composite rate could fall to zero, it’s guaranteed not to fall below that — so you’ll definitely get your initial investment back when you redeem the bond

    In general, you can only purchase up to $10,000 in I bonds each calendar year

    You might be able to completely or partially exclude savings bond interest from federal income tax when you pay qualified higher education expenses at an eligible institution or state tuition plan, in the same calendar year you redeem eligible I bonds

    “Even though they're one of the safest investments around, you need to hold them for at least a year and you'll forfeit a quarter's worth of interest if you redeem an I bond before five years,” Benz said

    in Naples, Fl., told Yahoo Money

    You and your spouse can each buy up to an additional $10,000 of I bonds for each one

  • DAP SEC-GEN SAYS ‘PREPARING FOR PARLIAMENT DISSOLUTION TOMORROW’

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/09/dap-sec-gen-says-preparing-for-parliament-dissolution-tomorrow/32648

    10/10/2022, 00:04

    42.86% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 9 — DAP secretary-general Anthony Loke tonight appeared to lend credence to fevered speculation that the general election is imminent

    In a Facebook post, the Seremban MP said that he was on his way back to Kuala Lumpur, after wrapping his tour of four northern states, to prepare for “the dissolution of Parliament tomorrow”

    “Now I am on my way back to KL to prepare for the dissolution of Parliament tomorrow,” Loke said in the Facebook post

    Meanwhile, Malay Mail reported that Umno is expected to call a special supreme council meeting tomorrow night, after the party’s political bureau meeting.

    ['kuala', 'lumpur', 'dap', 'general', 'loke']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 9 — DAP secretary-general Anthony Loke tonight appeared to lend credence to fevered speculation that the general election is imminent

    In a Facebook post, the Seremban MP said that he was on his way back to Kuala Lumpur, after wrapping his tour of four northern states, to prepare for “the dissolution of Parliament tomorrow”

    “Now I am on my way back to KL to prepare for the dissolution of Parliament tomorrow,” Loke said in the Facebook post

    Meanwhile, Malay Mail reported that Umno is expected to call a special supreme council meeting tomorrow night, after the party’s political bureau meeting.

  • GABRIEL MARTINELLI HAILS INFLUENCE GABRIEL JESUS HAS ON THE TEAM

    https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-11296393/Gabriel-Martinelli-hails-influence-Gabriel-Jesus-team.html

    10/09/2022, 21:04

    65.62% Shortened!

    Gabriel Martinelli has called on Arsenal to keep up their good form against Liverpool 'We're playing well,' Martinelli said

    'I think we need to keep the intensity that we are putting in

    'We need to only think about our team

    I'm very happy, but I need to keep up the hard work and play well.' Martinelli welcomed compatriot Gabriel Jesus to the Emirates during the off-season from Premier League champions Manchester City, with the forward becoming an instant favourite with the Gunners faithful

    Martinelli says he and his team-mates can learn a lot of things from forward Gabriel Jesus 'I can learn a lot of things from him (Jesus) because he's a very good guy

    'We have a very good team

  • 'MIRACLE' TODDLER SURVIVED THAILAND NURSERY MASSACRE ASLEEP UNDER BLANKET

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2022/10/09/039miracle039-toddler-survived-thailand-nursery-massacre-asleep-under-blanket

    10/09/2022, 21:04

    71.05% Shortened!

    Sunday, 09 Oct 2022

    Tawatchai Supolwong holds his 3-year-old daugther Paveenut Supolwong, nicknamed Ammy, who is the only child survivor of the day care centre mass shooting, during a family meeting at their home in Uthai Sawan, Nong Bua Lam Phu province, Thailand, October 9, 2022

    Paveenut Supolwong, nicknamed "Ammy", is normally a light sleeper, but at naptime on Thursday when the killer burst into the nursery and began murdering 22 children, Ammy was fast asleep with the blanket covering her face, her parents said

    She was the only child in the nursery to have escaped unscathed after former police officer Panya Khamrap killed more than 30 people, mostly children in the nursery, in a rampage through the town of Uthai Sawan

    "I'm in shock," said Ammy's mother, Panompai Sithong

    Ammy's parents said she seems to have no memory of the tragedy

    Ammy sat patiently in her mother's lap, looking around shyly through big eyes and playing with two candles she held

    Later in the day they sat for a Buddhist ceremony at the nursery, where mourners have left white floral wreaths and more presents

    At Ammy's home, her mother said she believed spirits had protected her little girl

    We have different beliefs, but to me, I think it protected my kid." Another relative told local media Ammy's survival was a "miracle"

    But the family had to break the news to her that her beloved best friend, two-year-old Techin, and her teacher were dead

    ['sunday', 'ammy', 'child', 'family', 'nursery']

  • LIVERPOOL INJURY BOOST COMES WITH ISSUE ATTACHED AS THIAGO AND LUIS DÍAZ BLOCK TWO RETURN PATHS

    https://www.liverpool.com/liverpool-fc-news/features/liverpool-injury-thiago-luis-diaz-25211214

    10/09/2022

    47.62% Shortened!

    Jürgen Klopp can now call upon another player for Liverpool, but it is increasingly hard to see where he fits

    Sign up to receive the best LFC opinion direct to your inbox We have more newsletters Liverpool’s midfield injury concerns seem to be gradually subsiding on Merseyside

    Curtis Jones is the latest player to return from the medical room, having taken part in team training this week after missing out on most of the new campaign

    He hasn’t featured since playing the last few seconds of Liverpool’s Community Shield bout with Manchester City in July

    A clearly-defined 4-3-3 was the team's set system when he last took to the field, with Jones primarily regarded as a left-sided number eight in the squad

    The tactical tweak poses a potential problem for Jones, who is an offensive box-to-box player rather than one who would be inclined to hold the fort, meaning he's now less suited to playing in central midfield for the Reds

    Our newsletter subscribers get a rundown Monday to Friday from one of the best Liverpool FC writers — straight to your inbox, and completely for free

    It poses the curious question as to where the 21-year-old will be deployed if 4-4-2 does indeed remain as Klopp's new first-choice option on Merseyside

    It is also possible for him to be deployed as a second striker of sorts, albeit one who would almost play as a number ten whenever his teammates have possession under control

    There are a few possible options for him but overall, the tactical move is not a positive one for Jones

    A change awaits for him as he tries to find a place in the team

    ['klopp', 'player', 'liverpool', 'newsletter', 'jones']

  • PM: PERIKATAN MINISTERS' LETTER TO KING DOES NOT AFFECT GOVT'S LEGITIMACY

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/09/pm-perikatan-ministers039-letter-to-king-does-not-affect-govt039s-legitimacy

    10/09/2022, 14:35

    54.17% Shortened!

    "However, the power of dissolution is between the Prime Minister and the King - the letter has no effect on the legitimacy of the government or the Prime Minister, as the MPs are still in support of the Prime Minister as before," said Ismail Sabri

    Hamzah told reporters on Saturday (Oct 8) that Perikatan Nasional had not withdrawn support for the Prime Minister and the letter had been sent to protest Umno's push for polls

    "The loss of confidence under the Federal Constitution is only when the MPs in Dewan Rakyat retract their support for the Prime Minister," said Ismail Sabri

    "Support for the Prime Minister is support from the MPs in Dewan Rakyat

    "If they retract that support and there are less than 112 MPs supporting the Prime Minister, and there is only a simple majority, then the government will collapse as what happened to Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin the last round and the government will change

    "That was why the last Cabinet had to step down

    "If the support of the Dewan Rakyat is still intact, there is no question of change in the support and there is no issue of the government collapsing

    "There is no quorum in the Cabinet

    If a minister writes a letter and retracts himself from the Cabinet, it does not mean he has resigned

    "If he has resigned, the Cabinet can still function and the government is still a functional one

    The Prime Minister can then appoint a new minister," said Ismail Sabri

    ['letter', 'minister', 'prime', 'ismail', 'sabri']

    "However, the power of dissolution is between the Prime Minister and the King - the letter has no effect on the legitimacy of the government or the Prime Minister, as the MPs are still in support of the Prime Minister as before," said Ismail Sabri

    Hamzah told reporters on Saturday (Oct 8) that Perikatan Nasional had not withdrawn support for the Prime Minister and the letter had been sent to protest Umno's push for polls

    "The loss of confidence under the Federal Constitution is only when the MPs in Dewan Rakyat retract their support for the Prime Minister," said Ismail Sabri

    "Support for the Prime Minister is support from the MPs in Dewan Rakyat

    "If they retract that support and there are less than 112 MPs supporting the Prime Minister, and there is only a simple majority, then the government will collapse as what happened to Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin the last round and the government will change

    "That was why the last Cabinet had to step down

    "If the support of the Dewan Rakyat is still intact, there is no question of change in the support and there is no issue of the government collapsing

    "There is no quorum in the Cabinet

    If a minister writes a letter and retracts himself from the Cabinet, it does not mean he has resigned

    "If he has resigned, the Cabinet can still function and the government is still a functional one

    The Prime Minister can then appoint a new minister," said Ismail Sabri

    ['letter', 'minister', 'prime', 'ismail', 'sabri']

  • CRIMEA BRIDGE RESUMES TRAFFIC AFTER BLAST, RUSSIAN ARMY LEADERSHIP CHANGED

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2022/10/09/crimea-bridge-resumes-traffic-after-blast-russian-army-leadership-changed/32538

    10/09/2022, 13:04

    64.52% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise MOSCOW, Oct 9 — Traffic resumed Saturday over a key bridge linking Russia with Crimea — seen as a symbol of the Kremlin's annexation of the peninsula — after it was partially destroyed by an explosion Moscow blamed on a truck bomb

    'Emergency situation' The bridge is logistically crucial for Moscow, a vital transport link for carrying military equipment to Russian soldiers fighting in Ukraine

    President Vladimir Putin personally inaugurated the bridge in 2018 — even driving a truck across it — and Moscow had maintained the crossing was safe despite the fighting

    "Crimea, the bridge, the beginning," he wrote

    "Everything illegal must be destroyed, everything stolen must be returned to Ukraine, everything occupied by Russia must be expelled." But in a later statement, he appeared to suggest that Moscow had a hand in the blast

    "It is worth noting that the truck that detonated, according to all indications, entered the bridge from the Russian side

    Officials in Moscow stopped short of blaming Kyiv, but a Russian-installed official in Crimea pointed the finger at "Ukrainian vandals." Calls for retaliation Some officials in Moscow and in Russian-occupied Ukraine called for retaliation

    Authorities in Crimea tried to calm fears of food and fuel shortages in Crimea, dependent on the Russian mainland since Moscow annexed it in 2014

    Moscow appoints new general After weeks of military setbacks, Moscow on Saturday announced that a new general — Sergei Surovikin — would take over its forces in Ukraine

    Surovikin previously led Russia's forces in southern Ukraine

    Also on Saturday, the governor of Russia's Belgorod region, which borders Ukraine, said Kyiv's forces had fired at a Russian border village, injuring a teenage girl

    ['moscow', 'bridge', 'ukraine', 'russian', 'say']

  • LIVERPOOL HAVE JUST BEEN SPARED DARWIN NÚÑEZ COMPARISONS AS ERLING HAALAND TRUTH BECOMES CLEAR

    Liverpool can now dismiss the 'battle' between Darwin Núñez and Erling Haaland this season, with the latest Man City revelations showing a clear difference

    Sign up to receive the best LFC opinion direct to your inbox We have more newsletters As Liverpool moved quickly to beat Manchester United to the signature of Darwin Núñez in the summer, many believed it to be a response to Manchester City on the part of Jürgen Klopp

    They, after all, had just moved for a number nine as well, acquiring Erling Haaland for his release clause fee

    They report that while his base salary is £375,000-per-week, bonuses that are 'almost guaranteed' mean that he is much closer to the territory of earnings that Kylian Mbappé secured in his new deal with Paris Saint-Germain

    At first, the Uruguayan was almost expected to match the output that Haaland has produced at the Etihad Stadium this season

    That's less than the £45m Haaland is reported to make in a single year

    Sign up to the Liverpool.com newsletter here — it only takes a few seconds!     And when his success comes to be judged, the Manchester City striker will be absolutely nowhere near the conversation.

  • 'NOT AFRAID ANYMORE': MORE VIOLENCE AS IRAN PROTESTS ENTER FOURTH WEEK

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2022/10/09/not-afraid-anymore-more-violence-as-iran-protests-enter-fourth-week/32544

    10/09/2022, 09:04

    64.52% Shortened!

    Iran said on Friday an investigation found Amini had died of a longstanding illness rather than "blows" to the head, despite her family reportedly saying she had previously been healthy

    Amini's father told London-based Iran International that he rejected the official report

    Young women on the same campus were seen shouting "Death to the oppressor", said the Oslo-based group Iran Human Rights (IHR)

    Gruesome videos were widely shared online of a man who was shot dead while sitting at the wheel of his car in Sanandaj, Kurdistan's capital

    Another shocking video shows a young woman said to have been shot dead in Mashhad

    In other footage, a man is seen altering the wording of a large government billboard on the same highway from "The police are the servants of the people" to "The police are the murderers of the people"

    On Friday, France advised its nationals visiting Iran to "leave the country as soon as possible", citing the risk of arbitrary detention

    The Netherlands advised its citizens to avoid travelling to Iran or to leave when they can do so safely

    Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, a British-Iranian charity worker held in Tehran for six years until her release in March, called on the UK government to act over Iran's rights abuses

    "We cannot be indifferent about what is happening in Iran," she told Sky News

    "And I think we have to hold Iran accountable." — AFP

    ['iran', 'tehran', 'police', 'woman', 'say']

    Iran said on Friday an investigation found Amini had died of a longstanding illness rather than "blows" to the head, despite her family reportedly saying she had previously been healthy

    Amini's father told London-based Iran International that he rejected the official report

    Young women on the same campus were seen shouting "Death to the oppressor", said the Oslo-based group Iran Human Rights (IHR)

    Gruesome videos were widely shared online of a man who was shot dead while sitting at the wheel of his car in Sanandaj, Kurdistan's capital

    Another shocking video shows a young woman said to have been shot dead in Mashhad

    In other footage, a man is seen altering the wording of a large government billboard on the same highway from "The police are the servants of the people" to "The police are the murderers of the people"

    On Friday, France advised its nationals visiting Iran to "leave the country as soon as possible", citing the risk of arbitrary detention

    The Netherlands advised its citizens to avoid travelling to Iran or to leave when they can do so safely

    Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, a British-Iranian charity worker held in Tehran for six years until her release in March, called on the UK government to act over Iran's rights abuses

    "We cannot be indifferent about what is happening in Iran," she told Sky News

    "And I think we have to hold Iran accountable." — AFP
