  • US AIMS TO HOBBLE CHINA’S CHIP INDUSTRY WITH SWEEPING NEW EXPORT RULES

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/money/2022/10/08/us-aims-to-hobble-chinas-chip-industry-with-sweeping-new-export-rules/32379

    10/08/2022, 08:02

    52.17% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise NEW YORK, Oct 8 — The Biden administration yesterday published a sweeping set of export controls, including a measure to cut China off from certain semiconductor chips made anywhere in the world with US equipment, vastly expanding its reach in its bid to slow Beijing’s technological and military advances

    The raft of measures could amount to the biggest shift in US policy toward shipping technology to China since the 1990s

    If effective, they could hobble China’s chip manufacturing industry by forcing American and foreign companies that use US technology to cut off support for some of China’s leading factories and chip designers

    “China isn’t going to give up on chipmaking ..

    but this will really slow them (down).” In a briefing with reporters on Thursday previewing the rules, senior government officials said many of the measures were aimed at preventing foreign firms from selling advanced chips to China or supplying Chinese firms with tools to make their own advanced chips

    “And we risk harming US technology leadership if foreign competitors are not subject to similar controls.” The expansion of US powers to control exports to China of chips made with US tools is based on a broadening of the so-called foreign direct product rule

    Yesterday, the Biden administration applied the expanded restrictions to China’s IFLYTEK, Dahua Technology, and Megvii Technology, companies added to the entity list in 2019 over allegations they aided Beijing in the suppression of its Uyghur minority group

    The rules published yesterday also block shipments of a broad array of chips for use in Chinese supercomputing systems

    Eric Sayers, a defence policy expert at the American Enterprise Institute, said the move reflects a new bid by the Biden administration to contain China’s advances instead of simply seeking to level the playing field

    The new regulations will also severely restrict export of US equipment to Chinese memory chip makers and formalise letters sent to Nvidia Corp and Advanced Micro Devices Inc (AMD) restricting shipments to China of chips used in supercomputing systems that nations around the world rely on to develop nuclear weapons and other military technologies

    Reuters was first to report key details of the new restrictions on memory chip makers, including a reprieve for foreign companies operating in China and the moves to broaden restrictions on shipments to China of technologies from KLA, Lam, Applied Materials, Nvidia and AMD

    ['china', 'chip', 'rule', 'chinese', 'technology']

    About Us Advertise NEW YORK, Oct 8 — The Biden administration yesterday published a sweeping set of export controls, including a measure to cut China off from certain semiconductor chips made anywhere in the world with US equipment, vastly expanding its reach in its bid to slow Beijing’s technological and military advances

    The raft of measures could amount to the biggest shift in US policy toward shipping technology to China since the 1990s

    If effective, they could hobble China’s chip manufacturing industry by forcing American and foreign companies that use US technology to cut off support for some of China’s leading factories and chip designers

    “China isn’t going to give up on chipmaking ..

    but this will really slow them (down).” In a briefing with reporters on Thursday previewing the rules, senior government officials said many of the measures were aimed at preventing foreign firms from selling advanced chips to China or supplying Chinese firms with tools to make their own advanced chips

    “And we risk harming US technology leadership if foreign competitors are not subject to similar controls.” The expansion of US powers to control exports to China of chips made with US tools is based on a broadening of the so-called foreign direct product rule

    Yesterday, the Biden administration applied the expanded restrictions to China’s IFLYTEK, Dahua Technology, and Megvii Technology, companies added to the entity list in 2019 over allegations they aided Beijing in the suppression of its Uyghur minority group

    The rules published yesterday also block shipments of a broad array of chips for use in Chinese supercomputing systems

    Eric Sayers, a defence policy expert at the American Enterprise Institute, said the move reflects a new bid by the Biden administration to contain China’s advances instead of simply seeking to level the playing field

    The new regulations will also severely restrict export of US equipment to Chinese memory chip makers and formalise letters sent to Nvidia Corp and Advanced Micro Devices Inc (AMD) restricting shipments to China of chips used in supercomputing systems that nations around the world rely on to develop nuclear weapons and other military technologies

    Reuters was first to report key details of the new restrictions on memory chip makers, including a reprieve for foreign companies operating in China and the moves to broaden restrictions on shipments to China of technologies from KLA, Lam, Applied Materials, Nvidia and AMD

    ['china', 'chip', 'rule', 'chinese', 'technology']



  • ECONOMISTS, BUSINESSES LAUD EXPANSIONARY BUDGET 2023 BUT FRET OVER PUTRAJAYA’S LACK OF NEW INCOME

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/08/economists-businesses-laud-expansionary-budget-2023-but-fret-over-putrajayas-lack-of-new-income/32364

    10/08/2022, 07:35

    65.62% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 8 — Pro-growth measures in Budget 2023 would help cushion the Malaysian economy against an expected global recession, according to economists and a trade group who lauded the overall plan

    However, they expressed misgivings over the government’s reluctance to widen its tax base, particularly by reintroducing the goods and services tax (GST) a previous rival administration had eliminated

    UniKL Business School Assoc Prof Aimi Zulhazmi Abdul Rashid said the record RM372 billion allocations — RM40 billion more than Budget 2022 — demonstrated the government’s seriousness in ensuring the country’s economy would be in the best position possible next year

    “This large Budget is needed to help the national economy fully recover, especially the SME (small and medium enterprises) sector, and to ensure that the domestic economy continues to be the (primary) engine next year when we are expected to face the global economic recession

    Elaborating, Aimi said a tougher global economy next year meant domestic trade must be the growth engine for the nation’s gross domestic product (GDP) and preserve jobs

    The same measure for micro-SMEs would also help protect their revenue stream during the same time, he said

    “I would say that the tax cut, together with other programmes for SMEs such as grants and loan scheme, sends a signal which is the moment ‘to ride the tiger’ and this can create positive expectations which may be helpful in facing eventual economic difficulties,” Ferlito explained

    “In particular, in the light of tax cuts

    Tax cuts are tremendously important, but they are one side of the coin

    However, he registered the ACCCIM’s disappointment that the government did not announce new tax reforms to widen its tax base, such as reintroducing the GST

    “We propose to the government to preannounce the implementation of GST on January, 1 2024, giving a lead time of 12 months for the preparation

    ['budget', 'would', 'government', 'tax', 'say']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 8 — Pro-growth measures in Budget 2023 would help cushion the Malaysian economy against an expected global recession, according to economists and a trade group who lauded the overall plan

    However, they expressed misgivings over the government’s reluctance to widen its tax base, particularly by reintroducing the goods and services tax (GST) a previous rival administration had eliminated

    UniKL Business School Assoc Prof Aimi Zulhazmi Abdul Rashid said the record RM372 billion allocations — RM40 billion more than Budget 2022 — demonstrated the government’s seriousness in ensuring the country’s economy would be in the best position possible next year

    “This large Budget is needed to help the national economy fully recover, especially the SME (small and medium enterprises) sector, and to ensure that the domestic economy continues to be the (primary) engine next year when we are expected to face the global economic recession

    Elaborating, Aimi said a tougher global economy next year meant domestic trade must be the growth engine for the nation’s gross domestic product (GDP) and preserve jobs

    The same measure for micro-SMEs would also help protect their revenue stream during the same time, he said

    “I would say that the tax cut, together with other programmes for SMEs such as grants and loan scheme, sends a signal which is the moment ‘to ride the tiger’ and this can create positive expectations which may be helpful in facing eventual economic difficulties,” Ferlito explained

    “In particular, in the light of tax cuts

    Tax cuts are tremendously important, but they are one side of the coin

    However, he registered the ACCCIM’s disappointment that the government did not announce new tax reforms to widen its tax base, such as reintroducing the GST

    “We propose to the government to preannounce the implementation of GST on January, 1 2024, giving a lead time of 12 months for the preparation

    ['budget', 'would', 'government', 'tax', 'say']



  • MAN UTD LEGEND MICHAEL CARRICK LINED UP FOR FIRST JOB SINCE LEAVING OLD TRAFFORD

    https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/man-utd-michael-carrick-manager-28184823

    10/08/2022, 07:06

    52.17% Shortened!

    Michael Carrick left Manchester United at the end of last year, having impressed during his short stint as the Red Devils manager following Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's sacking Michael Carrick is among the frontrunners to take over at Middlesbrough, with the Championship club keen to sound him out for talks

    The Manchester United legend has been out of work since he opted to leave Old Trafford following the appointment of Ralf Rangnick last year

    Carrick had worked closely alongside Ole Gunnar Solskjaer during his stint as boss, but stayed on following his dismissal in an interim capacity

    During his time in the dugout, the 41-year-old got a tune out of the underperforming United players, leading them to two wins, and a creditable draw away at Chelsea

    Carrick has been open about his ambitions to ultimately step into management and he is now one of the contenders for the vacant post at The Riverside Stadium

    Boro chairman Steve Gibson is now on the lookout for his permanent replacement and is hoping to tempt Wallsend-born Carrick to make the trip from Tyneside to Teesside

    Carrick, who spent six years at United in a coaching capacity - said while he enjoyed that role, becoming a manager was now a more appealing prospect for him

    The popular coach has worked alongside a number of head coaches during his time with the club and is now urging for patience to ensure the next decision is the correct one

    “I think the club now is managing their time to analyse the situation and who is the right person to be here,” Percovich said

    That Birmingham win is now in the past

    We used a lot of fuel to push for that result, but getting a result against Millwall is our target now." Read more Can United mount a title challenge? Get our FREE daily Manchester United email newsletter

    ['carrick', 'united', 'year', 'follow', 'time']

  • MALAYSIA'S BILLION-RINGGIT VAPING EMPIRE – AND THE ANTI-SMOKING BILL THAT COULD CURTAIL IT

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/cna-insider/malaysia-vaping-industry-anti-smoking-bill-generational-endgame-cigarettes-tobacco2992591

    10/08/2022

    77.08% Shortened!

    As a law to curb vape sales is proposed, Talking Point talks to a major player in Malaysia’s globe-spanning vaping industry

    These days, Zachary Oh’s company, Vape Empire, has 115 shops all over Malaysia, including in Borneo

    Oh’s business has grown in tandem with Malaysia’s vape industry which is estimated to be worth RM2.7 billion (S$830 million), according to a 2021 study by the Malaysian Vape Chamber of Commerce

    Amid growing concern over the rapid rise of vaping particularly among the young, and the controversy over its effect on health, Malaysia is set to introduce a game-changing law to ban smoking and vaping for an entire generation, those born from 2007

    Currently, the vape industry operates in a legal grey area in the country

    Vapes are touted by advocates as a smoking cessation tool

    To curb the harm of tobacco and nicotine products, Malaysia is debating the Control of Tobacco Products and Smoking Bill

    Also called the generational endgame bill, it seeks to ban the sale of cigarettes, tobacco and vape products to those born from 2007

    Many vape associations are against vaping products being included in the ban, and have called for regulation of their sale instead

    If I’m going to vape another tobacco flavour, how do I stop smoking?” He himself began vaping 10 years ago, and claims he managed to stop cigarette smoking seven years ago.  “My consumption of vapes has reduced (by) at least five times now

    Watch the first episode on vaping among Singapore youths here.

    ['vape', 'vaping', 'say', 'product', 'also']

    As a law to curb vape sales is proposed, Talking Point talks to a major player in Malaysia’s globe-spanning vaping industry

    These days, Zachary Oh’s company, Vape Empire, has 115 shops all over Malaysia, including in Borneo

    Oh’s business has grown in tandem with Malaysia’s vape industry which is estimated to be worth RM2.7 billion (S$830 million), according to a 2021 study by the Malaysian Vape Chamber of Commerce

    Amid growing concern over the rapid rise of vaping particularly among the young, and the controversy over its effect on health, Malaysia is set to introduce a game-changing law to ban smoking and vaping for an entire generation, those born from 2007

    Currently, the vape industry operates in a legal grey area in the country

    Vapes are touted by advocates as a smoking cessation tool

    To curb the harm of tobacco and nicotine products, Malaysia is debating the Control of Tobacco Products and Smoking Bill

    Also called the generational endgame bill, it seeks to ban the sale of cigarettes, tobacco and vape products to those born from 2007

    Many vape associations are against vaping products being included in the ban, and have called for regulation of their sale instead

    If I’m going to vape another tobacco flavour, how do I stop smoking?” He himself began vaping 10 years ago, and claims he managed to stop cigarette smoking seven years ago.  “My consumption of vapes has reduced (by) at least five times now

  • KEVIN DE BRUYNE THREATENS TO BURN MAN UTD SHIRT AS HE MAKES FEELINGS CLEAR ON RED DEVILS

    https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/de-bruyne-manutd-shirt-burn-28184341

    10/08/2022, 06:06

    56.0% Shortened!

    Fresh off helping Manchester City thrash their local rivals in the Premier League, tormentor-in-chief Kevin De Bruyne poked a fresh jab at Manchester United supporters Kevin De Bruyne proved he’s a true blue by threatening to burn a Manchester United shirt in a hilarious clip

    The Manchester City star has already been the reason for more than a few Old Trafford nightmares - and has now gone out of his way to deny a United dream

    Fresh off the back of humiliating their neighbours last weekend, De Bruyne showed there was no sympathy for those on the red half of the city

    Whilst making an appearance on Belgian podcast Mid Mid, the City ace was offered a United jersey with his name and number on the back

    However, while he was quick to dispose of that shirt, he has recently inherited a shirt from City’s rivals after successfully grabbing Cristiano Ronaldo ’s last week

    While he was pleased to get Ronaldo’s shirt, the smile was more likely down to the resounding nature of their win over the Red Devils

    "We set up quite good," said De Bruyne

    "We found the spaces in the first half and played a really good game

    I feel like whenever we've played away at United we have played really well, and when we've been at home they've won more than we did

    They had found a way to win some games

    "But here we played better

    ['manchester', 'city', 'bruyne', 'united', 'shirt']

  • JURGEN KLOPP TELLS DARWIN NUNEZ TO "GROW AS A MAN" AFTER LIVERPOOL LANGUAGE COMMENT

    https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/jurgen-klopp-tells-darwin-nunez-28181630

    10/08/2022, 06:03

    62.07% Shortened!

    Liverpool face Arsenal at the Emirates Stadium in the Premier League on Sunday with the club-record signing looking to reignite his season after a stop-start campaign so far in front of goal Jurgen Klopp has shrugged off the language barrier between him and Darwin Nunez, joking not being able to understand him helped Roberto Firmino

    Nunez claims he does not know what Klopp is saying and the Liverpool boss admits the £85million Uruguay striker has very limited English

    Klopp says this is not an issue because Liverpool have several Spanish speakers and quipped Firmino’s lack of English helped him when he first arrived at Anfield

    He’s a kid, but a confident person as well, but not a grown-up man already, we all know that

    That’s clear, but it’s all fine

    “The headline was he doesn’t understand a word I’m saying, I know that

    I understand why you ask that, but I would say it’s all fine.” Klopp feels Liverpool’s poor form has not helped Nunez, who banged in 32 goals for Benfica last season, and it is hard settling into a new team when they are struggling

    “We need to perform consistently to our level and beyond and then you need a striker to finish off all the things we create

    That’s why everybody should be optimistic about what’s coming from him in the future.” HAVE YOUR SAY! Will Nunez be a success at Liverpool?     We need to make sure he stops flying for a weekend.” Klopp refused to say if he would stick with the 4-2-3-1 formation, which worked so well against Rangers, claiming his main target for his team is to be unpredictable

    We have to be more unpredictable, definitely.” Read more What do Liverpool need to clinch the title? Keep up with all the Reds news with our FREE daily newsletter

  • ARTEEZY TALKS THE TOP TEAMS AT TI11 LAST CHANCE QUALIFIER, MAIN EVENT

    https://www.oneesports.gg/dota2/arteezy-ti11-last-chance-qualifier-main/

    10/08/2022

    52.17% Shortened!

    Artour “Arteezy” Babaev is backing three teams to come out of The International 11 Last Chance qualifier

    The Evil Geniuses carry said that Xtreme Gaming, Virtus Pro, and Team Liquid were the favorites to make it into the main event

    “They could have two of those three games that they lost, I thought

    “They just weren’t able to play focused and threw a lot of games.” Instead, Royal Never Give Up, sporting three members of the TI8 and TI9 PSG.LGD team, was the one to qualify directly to TI11 through the qualifiers, after a 3-0 sweep against XG

    Arteezy also called Virtus Pro a “stable” team, backing them to finish in the first two of the Last Chance Qualifiers

    The team, which contested part of this season’s Dota Pro Circuit as Outsiders, was one point away from securing a direct invite to TI11

    Losing to a revamped Team Secret in the Regional Qualifier meant they now have another hurdle to climb

    The TI10 grand finals in 2021 saw plucky underdogs Team Spirit take down the Chinese juggernauts, PSG.LGD

    One year later, the two teams retain the form that brought them to the top

    “But I don’t have that feeling about Spirit or LGD

    Subscribe to our monthly newsletter and get top-performing articles delivered right to your inbox

    *** Liverpool chief outlines Klopp plan Liverpool CEO Billy Hogan has detailed what the Reds plan to do when Jürgen Klopp leaves Anfield, with an ambassadorial role potentially being lined up

    We haven't talked about that (him becoming a club ambassador) yet, but I can well imagine that we'll discuss it one day! "He's already a Liverpool legend — his connection with Liverpool will last forever

    He also has such a connection to Dortmund and Mainz

    Jürgen would also be a phenomenal CEO

    Balagizi missed the game with Stevenage after the international break and has now come back to Liverpool to determine the extent of the damage and outline the full extent of the issue

    Our newsletter subscribers get a rundown Monday to Friday from one of the best Liverpool FC writers — straight to your inbox, and completely for free

    Liverpool boss Jürgen Klopp also confirmed in his press conference that Arthur Melo picked up an injury ahead of the Rangers game midweek, hence why he was absent there

    With Curtis Jones back fit again and in training, Liverpool do at least have one more option in him

    £62m midfielder linked Liverpool are lining up a January move for Lazio midfielder Sergej Milinković-Savić, according to Italian publication Calciomercato, who are reporting that Joe Gomez could be involved in a bizarre swap deal

    But the chances of Gomez plus €35m (£31m) being the deal on the table from a Liverpool perspective, if indeed the Reds are interested at all, are highly unlikely.

    Sign up to receive the best LFC opinion direct to your inbox We have more newsletters Welcome to the Liverpool.com daily Media Digest

    *** Liverpool chief outlines Klopp plan Liverpool CEO Billy Hogan has detailed what the Reds plan to do when Jürgen Klopp leaves Anfield, with an ambassadorial role potentially being lined up

    We haven't talked about that (him becoming a club ambassador) yet, but I can well imagine that we'll discuss it one day! "He's already a Liverpool legend — his connection with Liverpool will last forever

    He also has such a connection to Dortmund and Mainz

    Jürgen would also be a phenomenal CEO

    Balagizi missed the game with Stevenage after the international break and has now come back to Liverpool to determine the extent of the damage and outline the full extent of the issue

    Our newsletter subscribers get a rundown Monday to Friday from one of the best Liverpool FC writers — straight to your inbox, and completely for free

    Liverpool boss Jürgen Klopp also confirmed in his press conference that Arthur Melo picked up an injury ahead of the Rangers game midweek, hence why he was absent there

    With Curtis Jones back fit again and in training, Liverpool do at least have one more option in him

    £62m midfielder linked Liverpool are lining up a January move for Lazio midfielder Sergej Milinković-Savić, according to Italian publication Calciomercato, who are reporting that Joe Gomez could be involved in a bizarre swap deal

    But the chances of Gomez plus €35m (£31m) being the deal on the table from a Liverpool perspective, if indeed the Reds are interested at all, are highly unlikely.

    ['liverpool', 'midfielder', 'injury', 'newsletter', 'one']



  • NEW JÜRGEN KLOPP FORMATION COULD TRIGGER BOLD FSG CONTRACT DECISION AS LIVERPOOL REAP REWARDS

    https://www.liverpool.com/liverpool-fc-news/features/liverpool-formation-klopp-contract-fsg-25208306

    10/08/2022

    45.0% Shortened!

    Jürgen Klopp's new Liverpool formation could benefit many players — not just Darwin Núñez

    This in turn may lead to FSG making a bold contract decision

    The result of Jürgen Klopp's attempt to remedy Liverpool's poor run of form certainly paid dividends against Rangers

    But it wasn't just going forward where the 4-4-2 helped Liverpool to flourish

    Klopp's defence also looked a lot more compact and stable, and rarely let Rangers threaten — even on the counter, which has often been Liverpool's downfall this season

    Not only does it make Liverpool more compact in the middle, it seemed to bring the best out of Darwin Núñez, who played as the focal point of Liverpool's attack, and while the goal he sought eluded him, his performance and his positioning showed plenty of promise

    Another player who may benefit from the formation is Roberto Firmino, whom Klopp may have been resting for the much bigger game against Arsenal in the Premier League at the weekend

    It's clear Firmino could be a focal point of the system going forward if Klopp chooses to persist with it

    It will be intriguing to see whether Firmino gets the nod if Klopp decides to stick with the formation on Sunday against Arsenal

    Should the 4-4-2 become a regular occurrence, however, it is clear Firmino should remain a key part of Liverpool's strategy going forward

    Even though the 31-year-old's contract expires at the end of the season, a player of his quality who would suit the system so well is rare to find

    ['klopp', 'liverpool', 'formation', 'could', 'go']

    It's clear Firmino could be a focal point of the system going forward if Klopp chooses to persist with it

    It will be intriguing to see whether Firmino gets the nod if Klopp decides to stick with the formation on Sunday against Arsenal

    Should the 4-4-2 become a regular occurrence, however, it is clear Firmino should remain a key part of Liverpool's strategy going forward

    Even though the 31-year-old's contract expires at the end of the season, a player of his quality who would suit the system so well is rare to find

    ['klopp', 'liverpool', 'formation', 'could', 'go']

  • 'REMARKABLE REVERSAL': PRESIDENT BIDEN JUST (QUIETLY) SCALED BACK STUDENT LOAN FORGIVENESS — AND THE CHANGE COULD IMPACT UP TO 1.5M BORROWERS. ARE YOU ONE OF THEM?

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/remarkable-reversal-president-biden-just-174500701.html

    47.62% Shortened!

    The Department of Education reversed course last week by quietly scaling back on eligibility for President Biden’s student loan forgiveness plan

    If you owe $25K+ in student loans, there are ways to pay them off faster Too many Americans are still missing out on cheaper car insurance A TikToker paid off $17,000 in credit card debt by 'cash stuffing' — can it work for you? Biden’s student loan forgiveness plan made waves when it was first announced in August, with the promise that billions of dollars were about to be wiped from student loan records

    The department’s website originally stated that borrowers with privately held federal student loans, such as through the Federal Family Education Loan (FFEL) and Perkins programs, could receive relief by consolidating these loans into the Direct Loan program

    However, the guidance now specifies, that consolidation loans comprised of any FFEL or Perkins loans that aren’t held by the Education Department are only eligible for forgiveness if the borrower applied for consolidation before Sept

    The FFEL program was shuttered in 2010, but an administration official told NPR about 800,000 borrowers would now be excluded from relief

    Based on the statement provided to NPR, that may mean FFEL borrowers could receive one-time debt relief without having to consolidate

    They allege that Missouri's loan servicer is facing a “number of ongoing financial harms” by losing revenue from FFEL loans

    Department of Education over the potential tax liability for Americans

    The plaintiff — a lawyer with the foundation — argues that under his current Public Service Loan Forgiveness plan, he’ll already have his debts canceled after he’s made payments for 10 years

    And on top of that, with Biden’s forgiveness plan, he’ll be saddled with an additional state tax bill which he wouldn’t have under his current plan

    That being said, the Biden administration has indicated that borrowers can choose to opt out of the forgiveness plan if they wish

    ['department', 'loan', 'forgiveness', 'plan', 'borrower']

    The Department of Education reversed course last week by quietly scaling back on eligibility for President Biden’s student loan forgiveness plan

    If you owe $25K+ in student loans, there are ways to pay them off faster Too many Americans are still missing out on cheaper car insurance A TikToker paid off $17,000 in credit card debt by 'cash stuffing' — can it work for you?     The FFEL program was shuttered in 2010, but an administration official told NPR about 800,000 borrowers would now be excluded from relief

    The plaintiff — a lawyer with the foundation — argues that under his current Public Service Loan Forgiveness plan, he’ll already have his debts canceled after he’s made payments for 10 years

    And on top of that, with Biden’s forgiveness plan, he’ll be saddled with an additional state tax bill which he wouldn’t have under his current plan

    That being said, the Biden administration has indicated that borrowers can choose to opt out of the forgiveness plan if they wish

  • US NATIONAL DEBT NOW TOPS $31 TRILLION FOR THE FIRST TIME EVER — HERE'S WHO THE COUNTRY OWES

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/us-national-debt-now-tops-210000112.html

    56.0% Shortened!

    The gross national debt in America has hit new heights, surpassing $31 trillion, according to a U.S

    And with the dramatic rise in interest rates over the past few months — the Fed funds rate is currently between 3% and 3.35% — the national debt will be growing at a rate that makes it even harder to ignore

    Currently, more than $965 million is spent every day just in interest on the national debt

    There are different kinds of national debt

    Think about it like having a credit card, a mortgage and a car payment — all debt, but different

    Department of the Treasury manages the national debt, which is split between what one government agency owes to another and debts that are held by the public

    Intragovernmental debt accounts for about $6.5 trillion of the debt

    The much bigger piece of the debt is held by the public

    Right now, that’s about $24 trillion

    Domestically, the Federal Reserve holds the largest share of the public debt, at about 40%

    Ultimately, rising interest rates will only exacerbate the national debt, making it harder for the government to respond to a slowing economy

    ['national', 'debt', 'trillion', 'interest', 'rate']

    The gross national debt in America has hit new heights, surpassing $31 trillion, according to a U.S

    And with the dramatic rise in interest rates over the past few months — the Fed funds rate is currently between 3% and 3.35% — the national debt will be growing at a rate that makes it even harder to ignore

    Currently, more than $965 million is spent every day just in interest on the national debt

    There are different kinds of national debt

    Think about it like having a credit card, a mortgage and a car payment — all debt, but different

    Department of the Treasury manages the national debt, which is split between what one government agency owes to another and debts that are held by the public

    Intragovernmental debt accounts for about $6.5 trillion of the debt

    The much bigger piece of the debt is held by the public

    Right now, that’s about $24 trillion

    Domestically, the Federal Reserve holds the largest share of the public debt, at about 40%

    Ultimately, rising interest rates will only exacerbate the national debt, making it harder for the government to respond to a slowing economy

    ['national', 'debt', 'trillion', 'interest', 'rate']



  • ELON MUSK AND JASON CALACANIS MESSAGED ABOUT HOW RETURN-TO-OFFICE MANDATES COULD BE USED AS A ‘GENTLEMEN’S LAYOFF’ TO GET WORKERS TO VOLUNTARILY QUIT

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/elon-musk-jason-calacanis-messaged-213703298.html

    59.26% Shortened!

    Elon Musk’s Twitter acquisition saga may be exhausting, but it has revealed how some business leaders are thinking privately about return-to-office mandates

    Calacanis said in an exchange with Musk in April that a return-to-office mandate at Twitter—a reversal from the company’s current remote-work policy—could lead to 20% of Twitter’s staff voluntarily quitting

    And according to Calacanis, they’re using return-to-office mandates to do so

    Calacanis was quick to reach out to Musk after the news of his $44 billion Twitter acquisition offer first broke

    “Put me in the game coach! Twitter CEO is my dream job.” Calacanis went on to argue that Twitter could meet the standards of its Big Tech peers, at least in terms of revenue per employee, if it dramatically cut staff

    In a “back of the envelope” calculation, he said Twitter’s revenue per employee was just $625,000 in 2021, compared to $1.9 million per employee for Google and $2.37 million per employee for Apple—but if Musk were to cut 5,000 of Twitter’s 8,000 workers, he could increase Twitter’s revenue per employee to a “more industry standard” $1.66 million

    “Insane potential for improvement,” Musk responded after emphasizing Calacanis’s text

    Then Calacanis proposed using a return-to-office mandate to get rid of some of Twitter’s staff without having to pay the typical exit packages

    Twitter’s previous CEO, Jack Dorsey, implemented a “forever” remote-work policy in 2020 that allows Twitter employees to work wherever they are most productive

    “2 day a week office requirement = 20% voluntary departures,” Calacanis wrote

    “Maybe we don't talk Twitter on Twitter,” Calacanis wrote

    ['musk', 'twitter', 'return', 'office', 'company']

  • WALL STREET SLIPS AS JOBS GROWTH BOOSTS RATE HIKE BETS BY REUTERS

    https://www.investing.com/news/economy/nasdaq-futures-slip-on-amd-warning-jobs-data-awaited-2907248

    10/07/2022, 23:03

    52.17% Shortened!

    The report also showed the jobless rate fell to 3.5% in September, lower than expectations of 3.7%

    Traders now see a 92% chance of 75 basis-point hike by the Fed, up from 83.4% before data

    "Investors don't have confidence in a soft landing because the Fed continues to have to ramp higher and higher to begin to slow the economy down." The Philadelphia Semiconductor SE index shed 4.2%, and was set for its biggest one-day percentage decline in nearly a month as a revenue warning from Advanced Micro Devices Inc signaled the chip slump could be worse than expected

    The S&P 500 technology sector index fell 3.1%, leading declines among the 11 major sector indexes

    ET, the Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 488.84 points, or 1.63%, at 29,438.10, the S&P 500 was down 80.05 points, or 2.14%, at 3,664.47, and the Nasdaq Composite was down 309.86 points, or 2.80%, at 10,763.45

    All three main Wall Street indexes are still set to snap a three-week losing streak, heading for their biggest weekly gain in almost a month

    The S&P index recorded two new 52-week highs and 49 new lows, while the Nasdaq recorded 12 new highs and 148 new lows

  • TENGKU ZAFRUL: BUDGET 2023 CAN BE TABLED AGAIN IF PARLIAMENT DISSOLVED HALFWAY THROUGH DEBATE

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/07/tengku-zafrul-budget-2023-can-be-tabled-again-if-parliament-dissolved-halfway-through-debate/32348

    10/07/2022, 22:35

    44.44% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 7 — Finance Minister Datuk Seri Tengku Zafrul Abdul Aziz dismissed claims that Budget 2023 would be redundant should Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob decide to dissolve Parliament before the federal spending plan is granted passage

    The Budget was presented and there was a dissolution and then the Budget was represented again,” he said

    “So that is what will happen if there is a dissolution

    This in turn prompted critics of the government to suggest the Budget would be rendered “meaningless” if dissolution happens before the spending plan is passed

    The Ismail Sabri-led administration unveiled a record RM372 billion federal spending plan for next year, with over RM90 billion worth of development expenditure in what is set to be the largest Budget allocated for expansion to date.

    ['minister', 'budget', 'ismail', 'sabri', 'parliament']

  • WHY THE FED’S HIKES ARE NOT SHOWING UP IN YOUR SAVINGS ACCOUNT

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/why-fed-hikes-not-showing-140700604.html

    50.0% Shortened!

    The US Federal Reserve’s latest bout of interest rate hikes has been brutal

    But not all interest rates are reacting instantly to the Fed’s tightening

    Read more 3 ways to reduce invisible labor for women at work 36 ways to build a family-friendly culture Restaurant menu screens are looking at you to decide what you might want to eat The Fed’s interest rate hikes make overnight borrowing for banks more expensive

    The higher rates also help banks keep deposits from flowing out to money market funds, which are full of interest-rate sensitive Treasury bills

    It usually takes a while for the Fed’s rate to feed through to rates on savings deposits

    But this time around, the lag has been unusually long because banks can’t keep up with the Fed’s rapid pace of rate hikes, said Bill Nelson, the chief economist at the Bank Policy Institute

    As a result, the average interest rate on savings has only moved to 0.16% from 0.06% when the Fed started hiking

    datawrapper-chart-ATADd But there is a big gap between the average and the top yields on savings accounts, which have been hitting levels not seen since 2009 and are tracking the increase in the Fed’s rate quite closely

    Mortgage lenders, which typically offer fixed-rate loans, are getting hit by both inflation and fewer buyers

    To cope, they are raising their rates at a faster pace than the Fed

    datawrapper-chart-ANDw5 With the Fed expected to keep raising rates, expect borrowing to become even more expensive throughout 2023.

    ['interest', 'rate', 'fed', 'bank', 'saving']

    The US Federal Reserve’s latest bout of interest rate hikes has been brutal

    But not all interest rates are reacting instantly to the Fed’s tightening

    Read more 3 ways to reduce invisible labor for women at work 36 ways to build a family-friendly culture Restaurant menu screens are looking at you to decide what you might want to eat The Fed’s interest rate hikes make overnight borrowing for banks more expensive

    The higher rates also help banks keep deposits from flowing out to money market funds, which are full of interest-rate sensitive Treasury bills

    It usually takes a while for the Fed’s rate to feed through to rates on savings deposits

    But this time around, the lag has been unusually long because banks can’t keep up with the Fed’s rapid pace of rate hikes, said Bill Nelson, the chief economist at the Bank Policy Institute

    As a result, the average interest rate on savings has only moved to 0.16% from 0.06% when the Fed started hiking

    datawrapper-chart-ATADd But there is a big gap between the average and the top yields on savings accounts, which have been hitting levels not seen since 2009 and are tracking the increase in the Fed’s rate quite closely

    Mortgage lenders, which typically offer fixed-rate loans, are getting hit by both inflation and fewer buyers

    To cope, they are raising their rates at a faster pace than the Fed

    datawrapper-chart-ANDw5 With the Fed expected to keep raising rates, expect borrowing to become even more expensive throughout 2023.

    ['interest', 'rate', 'fed', 'bank', 'saving']

    Rooney, who played with Ronaldo at United between 2004-2009, said the 37-year-old will be finding his lack of game time hard to swallow

    "The manager's obviously gone a different way in terms of how they're playing and been successful," Rooney, who now manages Major League Soccer side DC United, told reporters on Friday

    He's obviously not the player he was when he was 22 or 23, for instance

  • FAKE MEAT SALES ARE NOW PLUNGING BECAUSE OF HIGH PRICES AND BEING TOO 'WOKE' FOR CONSUMERS ⁠— HERE'S THE 1 TIMELESS TAKEAWAY FOR INVESTORS

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/fake-meat-sales-now-plunging-100000695.html

    68.57% Shortened!

    Just a few years ago, the rise of plant-based meat seemed inevitable

    Major grocery stores and fast food joints started adding these faux meat alternatives to their product mix as consumer demand skyrocketed

    Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods mention “climate change” and “animal welfare” several times on their website and in corporate reports

    Food costs have been a key driver of inflation this year

    Niche fake meat products are likely to struggle in this environment

    Products from Impossible Foods and Beyond Meat cost significantly more than traditional meat brands because they lack the economies of scale of their larger competitors

    Industry experts believe fake meat brands could take 15 to 20 years to achieve price parity with regular meat

    Which means consumers struggling with their grocery bills may have substituted their meat already

    The rapid rise and sudden fall of fake meat holds an important lesson for investors

    have outperformed the stock market this year

    Conagra stock is flat and Hormel is down 4.5% — while the S&P 500 has lost 21% of its value year-to-date

    ['year', 'meat', 'food', 'product', 'consumer']

    Just a few years ago, the rise of plant-based meat seemed inevitable

    Major grocery stores and fast food joints started adding these faux meat alternatives to their product mix as consumer demand skyrocketed

    Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods mention “climate change” and “animal welfare” several times on their website and in corporate reports

    Food costs have been a key driver of inflation this year

    Niche fake meat products are likely to struggle in this environment

    Products from Impossible Foods and Beyond Meat cost significantly more than traditional meat brands because they lack the economies of scale of their larger competitors

    Industry experts believe fake meat brands could take 15 to 20 years to achieve price parity with regular meat

    Which means consumers struggling with their grocery bills may have substituted their meat already

    The rapid rise and sudden fall of fake meat holds an important lesson for investors

    have outperformed the stock market this year

    Conagra stock is flat and Hormel is down 4.5% — while the S&P 500 has lost 21% of its value year-to-date

    ['year', 'meat', 'food', 'product', 'consumer']



  • THAI MASSACRE LEAVES TRAUMATISED RELATIVES CLINGING TO SLAIN CHILDREN'S TOYS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2022/10/07/thai-massacre-leaves-traumatised-relatives-clinging-to-slain-children039s-toys

    10/07/2022, 20:03

    66.67% Shortened!

    Friday, 07 Oct 2022

    Relatives pray during a ceremony for those killed in the attack on the Young Children's Development Center in the rural town of Uthai Sawan, north eastern Thailand, on Oct

    Most of the children, aged between two and five, were slashed to death, while adults were shot, police said in the aftermath of the worst child death toll in a massacre by a single killer in recent history

    Prime Minister Prayut Chan-O-Cha was set to visit on Friday, and government officials laid royal wreaths and flowers outside the daycare centre

    Police identified the attacker as Panya Khamrap, 34, a former police sergeant who was discharged over drug accusations and who was facing trial on a drugs charge

    Panya went to the daycare centre to pick up his child after attending court earlier in the day, police spokesperson Paisal Luesomboon told broadcaster ThaiPBS

    When he did not find his child there, he began the killing spree

    One witness, Kittisak Polprakan, said he saw the attacker calmly walking out of the centre after the massacre, "as if he was just taking a normal stroll"

    Police official Chakkraphat Wichitvaidya told Reuters autopsies showed the children had been slashed with a large knife, sometimes multiple times, and adults shot

    "He didn’t say anything, he shot at the door while the kids were sleeping," said another woman, becoming distraught

    About 30 children were at the centre when the attack began, fewer than usual as heavy rain had kept many people away, said district official Jidapa Boonsom

    Hundreds of people posted condolences on the Facebook page of the Mutahi Sawant Child Development Centre under its last post before the massacre, an account of a visit the children made to a Buddhist temple in September

    ['kill', 'child', 'thailand', 'centre', 'police']

    Friday, 07 Oct 2022

    Relatives pray during a ceremony for those killed in the attack on the Young Children's Development Center in the rural town of Uthai Sawan, north eastern Thailand, on Oct

    Most of the children, aged between two and five, were slashed to death, while adults were shot, police said in the aftermath of the worst child death toll in a massacre by a single killer in recent history

    Prime Minister Prayut Chan-O-Cha was set to visit on Friday, and government officials laid royal wreaths and flowers outside the daycare centre

    Police identified the attacker as Panya Khamrap, 34, a former police sergeant who was discharged over drug accusations and who was facing trial on a drugs charge

    Panya went to the daycare centre to pick up his child after attending court earlier in the day, police spokesperson Paisal Luesomboon told broadcaster ThaiPBS

    When he did not find his child there, he began the killing spree

    One witness, Kittisak Polprakan, said he saw the attacker calmly walking out of the centre after the massacre, "as if he was just taking a normal stroll"

    Police official Chakkraphat Wichitvaidya told Reuters autopsies showed the children had been slashed with a large knife, sometimes multiple times, and adults shot

    "He didn’t say anything, he shot at the door while the kids were sleeping," said another woman, becoming distraught

    About 30 children were at the centre when the attack began, fewer than usual as heavy rain had kept many people away, said district official Jidapa Boonsom

    Hundreds of people posted condolences on the Facebook page of the Mutahi Sawant Child Development Centre under its last post before the massacre, an account of a visit the children made to a Buddhist temple in September

    ['kill', 'child', 'thailand', 'centre', 'police']

    10/07/2022, 20:03

    Sign up for our daily newsletter to get the day's biggest stories sent direct to your inbox We have more newsletters Erik ten Hag wanted to formulate a squad at Manchester United and he has got one

    Against Manchester City on Sunday, he had five-time Ballon d’Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo, five-time Champions League winner Casemiro and the revitalised Anthony Martial all in the dugout

    Ten Hag has been given interesting insight about who he can trust in the matches following the international break

    After the 6-3 loss to City, United found themselves 1-0 down to Omonia at half-time on Thursday

    Goals from Martial and Marcus Rashford dug them out of the mire

    Meanwhile, Jadon Sancho has been tame at best in United’s last two fixtures

    Ten Hag also has a decision on his hands at left-back

    He is Ten Hag’s first signing as United boss but Shaw looked lean and ready to go in his two second-half outings this week

    Shaw may feel slightly aggrieved if Malacia still retains his place at Goodison Park, so it comes down to whether Ten Hag will opt to save face or be ruthless

    United will ultimately shell out £70m for 30-year-old Casemiro and fans will expect him to perform soon

    So will Ten Hag, and the only way that can happen is by playing more with his teammates

    But with a trip to the Premier League leaders up next for Liverpool, Merson has cautioned Klopp about continuing with his new system

    " Liverpool played against Rangers in the UEFA Champions League on Tuesday and won quite comfortably, while Arsenal are in UEFA Europa League action later today

    "Roberto Firmino could come back into the team for this one, while Fabinho could slot into midfield to give them some more protection away from home

    I just fancy Arsenal, but I'm not as confident as I was against Tottenham

    HAVE YOUR SAY! What should be Liverpool's starting line-up for the trip to Arsenal? Comment below

    We have to be more unpredictable," Klopp said

    Whatever system we play, there's no system in the world with no weakness

    So you cannot say we're back, we need consistency

  • EPF'S INVESTMENT INCOME FALLS 21% TO RM27BIL IN 1H22

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2022/10/07/epf039s-investment-income-falls-21-to-rm27bil-in-1h22

    10/07/2022, 20:03

    69.44% Shortened!

    In a statement, the retirement fund said the lower investment income was due to the market reaction to the elevated risk of both slower global growth and high inflation, not experienced by major economies since the 1970s

    The EPF’s total gross investment income for the second quarter (2Q22) was RM11.14bil, down RM3.63bil from RM14.77bil recorded in the same quarter last year

    Equities continued to be the main contributor of income for 2Q22 at RM4.88bil, accounting for 44% of the total gross investment income in the quarter under review

    The consistent downtrend impacted EPF’s equity earnings, especially through global stock markets, which declined between 17% and 21% during the 1H 2022.” “Nonetheless, the EPF’s diversification into different asset classes, markets, and currencies, as prescribed in its strategic asset allocation (SAA), has helped the EPF to remain resilient against turbulent market conditions and to protect its long-term investment returns,” he said

    EPF said this portfolio was gradually becoming more important for the EPF’s diversification efforts as the volatility in listed equity markets remained high

    Fixed income instruments, comprising Malaysian Government Securities and equivalent, as well as loans and bonds, contributed a significant portion of gross investment income for 2Q22, at 42% of total income or RM4.73bil

    In 2Q22, the EPF’s overseas investments, which make up 36% of EPF total investment assets, generated RM5.51bil in income, representing 49% of the total gross investment income recorded

    Taking into account the effect of the RM2.15bil that was written down for listed equities during the quarter, the EPF’s total investment income in 2Q22 was RM8.98bil

    However, the EPF’s asset growth remained healthy as contributions received amounting to RM43.23bil as at June 2022 supported by the income generated from its investments

    This was attributed to the strong growth of new member registrations of 177,230 in the second quarter of 2022 to a total of 323,416 for the 1H22, adding to the total number of EPF members as at June 2022 of 15.5 million

    Wage growth was broad-based across the income spectrum of active members

    ['epf', 'total', 'investment', 'income', 'market']

    In a statement, the retirement fund said the lower investment income was due to the market reaction to the elevated risk of both slower global growth and high inflation, not experienced by major economies since the 1970s

    The EPF’s total gross investment income for the second quarter (2Q22) was RM11.14bil, down RM3.63bil from RM14.77bil recorded in the same quarter last year

    Equities continued to be the main contributor of income for 2Q22 at RM4.88bil, accounting for 44% of the total gross investment income in the quarter under review

    The consistent downtrend impacted EPF’s equity earnings, especially through global stock markets, which declined between 17% and 21% during the 1H 2022.” “Nonetheless, the EPF’s diversification into different asset classes, markets, and currencies, as prescribed in its strategic asset allocation (SAA), has helped the EPF to remain resilient against turbulent market conditions and to protect its long-term investment returns,” he said

    EPF said this portfolio was gradually becoming more important for the EPF’s diversification efforts as the volatility in listed equity markets remained high

    Fixed income instruments, comprising Malaysian Government Securities and equivalent, as well as loans and bonds, contributed a significant portion of gross investment income for 2Q22, at 42% of total income or RM4.73bil

    In 2Q22, the EPF’s overseas investments, which make up 36% of EPF total investment assets, generated RM5.51bil in income, representing 49% of the total gross investment income recorded

    Taking into account the effect of the RM2.15bil that was written down for listed equities during the quarter, the EPF’s total investment income in 2Q22 was RM8.98bil

    However, the EPF’s asset growth remained healthy as contributions received amounting to RM43.23bil as at June 2022 supported by the income generated from its investments

    This was attributed to the strong growth of new member registrations of 177,230 in the second quarter of 2022 to a total of 323,416 for the 1H22, adding to the total number of EPF members as at June 2022 of 15.5 million

    Wage growth was broad-based across the income spectrum of active members

  • MALAYSIAN WOMAN SAVES ABOUT RM500 A YEAR BY PLANTING GREENS IN HER GARDEN

    https://www.thestar.com.my/lifestyle/living/2022/10/07/malaysian-woman-saves-about-rm500-a-year-by-planting-greens-in-her-garden

    10/07/2022, 19:35

    86.42% Shortened!

    Muhammad Idriz and his sister Rania help their mother to slice vegetables that they’ve harvested from their garden

    I plant whatever that grows in abundance

    I encourage my children to eat vegetables from our garden that we grow ourselves as they are nutritious, fresh and minus pesticides.” Green thumb family Zarah was never interested in gardening..

    “Our community garden is pretty active

    Gardening helps Zarah bond with Rania

    Zarah and Ahmad also began reading about growing vegetables and surfed the Internet for ideas on how to plant greens in their garden

    Over time, their older children, Muhammad Malik, 16, and Rania Yasmin, 14, were also roped in to help in the garden

    The kids were thrilled as we never expected to grow vegetables in our garden

    “Muhammad Idriz planted kangkung, and he is so happy that there’s been a constant supply of kangkung in our garden

    Next to my garden is a pathway that leads to the neighbourhood playground

    I think many people have the ability to grow vegetable, ornamental plants or flowers

    ['muhammad', 'vegetable', 'harvest', 'garden', 'zarah']

    When they have their back to the game and have to be a wallflower, they don't like that, they want to be on the move and running at people.'     Friday, 07 Oct 2022

    "My wife and my child have gone to a peaceful place

    If I can’t go on, my wife and my child will be worried about me, and they won’t be reborn in the next life

    That’s about it.” Many relatives were gathered in front of the child care centre to start the process of claiming compensation and psychologists were also sent to the site to help them

    Seven of the 10 people who were wounded were still hospitalised on Friday

    When asked whether he thought the child care centre was secure enough, Seksan noted the attacker had been a police officer

    He had been due to appear in court on Friday

    Witnesses said the attacker got out of a car and shot a man and child in front of the building before walking toward the classroom

    Teachers at the child care centre locked the glass front door, but the gunman shot and kicked his way through it

    In an interview with Amarin TV, Satita Boonsom, a childcare worker at the daycare center, said the assailant after arriving at the scene shot a child and his father in front of the building before walking toward the classroom

  • INDONESIAN POLICE TO CHARGE SIX PEOPLE IN FOOTBALL DISASTER

    https://www.espn.com/soccer/story/4763029/indonesian-police-to-charge-six-people-in-football-disaster

    10/07/2022, 15:03

    47.62% Shortened!

    Indonesian police said they are bringing criminal charges against three officers and three civilians for their roles in the deaths of 131 people last Saturday when police fired tear gas inside a stadium, setting off a panicked run for the exits in which many were crushed

    Prabowo said charges are also being brought against the chief executive of the match, the chief security officer and three police officers

    He said the Malang police head of operations is believed to have known that FIFA, the international governing body, has advised against the use of tear gas in stadiums

    "However, he did not prevent or prohibit the use of tear gas when securing the match," Prabowo said in a televised news conference

    He said the two other police officers had ordered their subordinates to fire the tear gas

    Those rules don't necessarily apply to domestic or national leagues but nevertheless are a safety standard, as is the recommendation against the use of tear gas as a crowd-control measure

    Following the defeat, angry fans rushed into the infield, prompting police to fire the tear gas

    "In our investigation, we found there was no emergency plan to handle special cases as is required in the Football Association of Indonesia's 2021 security and safety regulations," Prabowo said

    The Football Association of Indonesia has banned Arema from hosting any matches attended by its supporters in Malang until next year

    Meanwhile, Indonesia President Joko Widodo said on Friday that FIFA will not impose sanctions on the country

    In a video message, the president said Indonesia would work with FIFA to improve its management of soccer matches and that FIFA president Gianni Infantino will visit Indonesia in October or November.

    ['police', 'say', 'tear', 'gas', 'indonesia']

    Indonesian police said they are bringing criminal charges against three officers and three civilians for their roles in the deaths of 131 people last Saturday when police fired tear gas inside a stadium, setting off a panicked run for the exits in which many were crushed

    Prabowo said charges are also being brought against the chief executive of the match, the chief security officer and three police officers

    He said the Malang police head of operations is believed to have known that FIFA, the international governing body, has advised against the use of tear gas in stadiums

    "However, he did not prevent or prohibit the use of tear gas when securing the match," Prabowo said in a televised news conference

    He said the two other police officers had ordered their subordinates to fire the tear gas

    Those rules don't necessarily apply to domestic or national leagues but nevertheless are a safety standard, as is the recommendation against the use of tear gas as a crowd-control measure

    Following the defeat, angry fans rushed into the infield, prompting police to fire the tear gas

    "In our investigation, we found there was no emergency plan to handle special cases as is required in the Football Association of Indonesia's 2021 security and safety regulations," Prabowo said

    The Football Association of Indonesia has banned Arema from hosting any matches attended by its supporters in Malang until next year

    Meanwhile, Indonesia President Joko Widodo said on Friday that FIFA will not impose sanctions on the country

    In a video message, the president said Indonesia would work with FIFA to improve its management of soccer matches and that FIFA president Gianni Infantino will visit Indonesia in October or November.

  • HOW TO AVOID GETTING SCAMMED: EXPERT TIPS TO DODGE SPAM CALLS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/tech/tech-news/2022/10/07/how-to-avoid-getting-scammed-expert-tips-to-dodge-spam-calls

    10/07/2022, 14:03

    69.44% Shortened!

    One technology expert said to avoid getting spam calls, stop giving out your phone number

    No sooner does the phone stop ringing than a different unknown number lights up on the screen

    One technology expert said to avoid getting spam calls, stop giving out your phone number

    “The challenge with smartphone phone numbers is that people are using them as their primary number and you get into the habit of giving that number out to everyone,” Kelso said

    “And in the case of handing out your phone number to everyone, there is a good chance that your cellphone number will be leaked in a large-scale data breach.” Shawn Kobzej also has been struggling with spam calls and said this is what happened to him a couple of months ago

    “My phone just wouldn’t stop ringing all day long and it was just terribly annoying.” Along with not giving out personal numbers, Kelso said people can set up a second, free number through companies like WhatsApp or Google voice or talk to phone companies about programs to reduce robocalls

    After phone numbers are in the hands of scammers, Kelso said cybercriminals can spoof, or mimic, numbers and use them to call people in that area, making the call seem more realistic

    Doyle asked his phone company what he can do about this but hasn’t acted on anything yet

    “They said, of course, you can change your phone number, but I mean, we’re just not really in the place where we can do that,” Doyle said

    Kelso said the reason cybercriminals do this is to get victims to react

    “Voicemail is probably your best friend because at least then you know if it’s a legitimate call, someone is going to leave a voicemail message for you to call back,” Kelso said

    ['say', 'get', 'spam', 'call', 'phone']

    One technology expert said to avoid getting spam calls, stop giving out your phone number

    No sooner does the phone stop ringing than a different unknown number lights up on the screen

    One technology expert said to avoid getting spam calls, stop giving out your phone number

    “The challenge with smartphone phone numbers is that people are using them as their primary number and you get into the habit of giving that number out to everyone,” Kelso said

    “And in the case of handing out your phone number to everyone, there is a good chance that your cellphone number will be leaked in a large-scale data breach.” Shawn Kobzej also has been struggling with spam calls and said this is what happened to him a couple of months ago

    “My phone just wouldn’t stop ringing all day long and it was just terribly annoying.” Along with not giving out personal numbers, Kelso said people can set up a second, free number through companies like WhatsApp or Google voice or talk to phone companies about programs to reduce robocalls

    After phone numbers are in the hands of scammers, Kelso said cybercriminals can spoof, or mimic, numbers and use them to call people in that area, making the call seem more realistic

    Doyle asked his phone company what he can do about this but hasn’t acted on anything yet

    “They said, of course, you can change your phone number, but I mean, we’re just not really in the place where we can do that,” Doyle said

    Kelso said the reason cybercriminals do this is to get victims to react

    “Voicemail is probably your best friend because at least then you know if it’s a legitimate call, someone is going to leave a voicemail message for you to call back,” Kelso said

    ['say', 'get', 'spam', 'call', 'phone']



  • WHO IS CHINA’S PRESIDENT XI JINPING?

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2022/10/07/who-is-chinas-president-xi-jinping/32224

    10/07/2022, 13:03

    78.43% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise BEIJING, Oct 7 — When Xi Jinping took power in 2012, some observers predicted he would be the most liberal Communist Party leader in China’s history, based on his low-key profile, family backstory and perhaps a degree of misguided hope

    Chan, author of a book on Xi’s life, told AFP

    “I would suggest that he strives for power as an instrument..

    “He really has a vision about China, he wants to see China as the most powerful country in the world.” Central to that vision — what Xi calls the “Chinese Dream” or “great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation” — is the role of the Communist Party (CCP)

    Beginning as a village party boss in 1974, Xi climbed to the governorship of coastal Fujian province in 1999, then party chief of Zhejiang province in 2002 and eventually Shanghai in 2007

    and so on,” said biographer Geiges

    “The absolute centrality of the party’s mission to make China a great country again is evident from Xi’s earliest recorded statements,” wrote Brown

    Xi has harnessed that narrative of an ascendant China to great effect, using nationalism as a tool for his own and the party’s legitimacy among the population

    But there is also evidence he fears that grasp on power might decline

    “So he decided that something like this shall not happen to China..

    that’s why he wants strong leadership of the Communist Party, with one strong leader.” — AFP

    ['power', 'party', 'china', 'family', 'say']

    About Us Advertise BEIJING, Oct 7 — When Xi Jinping took power in 2012, some observers predicted he would be the most liberal Communist Party leader in China’s history, based on his low-key profile, family backstory and perhaps a degree of misguided hope

    Chan, author of a book on Xi’s life, told AFP

    “I would suggest that he strives for power as an instrument..

    “He really has a vision about China, he wants to see China as the most powerful country in the world.” Central to that vision — what Xi calls the “Chinese Dream” or “great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation” — is the role of the Communist Party (CCP)

    Beginning as a village party boss in 1974, Xi climbed to the governorship of coastal Fujian province in 1999, then party chief of Zhejiang province in 2002 and eventually Shanghai in 2007

    and so on,” said biographer Geiges

    “The absolute centrality of the party’s mission to make China a great country again is evident from Xi’s earliest recorded statements,” wrote Brown

    Xi has harnessed that narrative of an ascendant China to great effect, using nationalism as a tool for his own and the party’s legitimacy among the population

    But there is also evidence he fears that grasp on power might decline

    “So he decided that something like this shall not happen to China..

    that’s why he wants strong leadership of the Communist Party, with one strong leader.” — AFP

    ['power', 'party', 'china', 'family', 'say']



  • QUICKCHECK: WILL CUSTOMS FORMS HAVE TO BE FILLED WHEN LEAVING OR ARRIVING IN MALAYSIA?

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/true-or-not/2022/10/07/quickcheck-will-customs-forms-have-to-be-filled-when-leaving-or-arriving-in-malaysia

    10/07/2022, 12:36

    42.11% Shortened!

    IT was reported that travellers arriving in or leaving Malaysia will now have to fill up Customs declaration forms

    CAAM chief executive officer Datuk Capt Chester Voo said the Royal Malaysian Customs Department (RMCD) through a letter dated Sept 5 stated that the declaration of Customs Form No

    7 (K7) is a requirement under Section 103 of the Custom Act 1967

    "To comply with the provisions of this legislation for passengers arriving in Malaysia by air, RMCD requests the cooperation of all airlines entering Malaysia to make announcements to all passengers on the requirement to fill up Form K7 and to submit it to the duty officer of Customs at the airport," he said

    CAAM has even provided a sample announcement to be made on the flight before the plane lands in Malaysia, both in English and Malay

    "The declaration shall be made by using Customs Form No

    7 is available at the RMCD counter

    "Any false declarations or failure to declare is an offence under Malaysian law." On the decision, Voo said that every passenger or other person arriving in or leaving Malaysia shall declare all dutiable or prohibited goods in his possession, either on his person or in any baggage or in any vehicle, to the proper officer of Customs

    55 of the Customs Regulation 2019, every traveller or other person arriving in or leaving Malaysia shall declare in Form Customs No.7 in the Third Schedule," he said in a statement on Tuesday (Oct 4)

    Thank you for your report! Copyright © 1995-

    Kindly fill the form below We hope you enjoy this feature!

    ['traveller', 'arrive', 'malaysia', 'custom', 'declaration']

    IT was reported that travellers arriving in or leaving Malaysia will now have to fill up Customs declaration forms

    CAAM chief executive officer Datuk Capt Chester Voo said the Royal Malaysian Customs Department (RMCD) through a letter dated Sept 5 stated that the declaration of Customs Form No

    7 (K7) is a requirement under Section 103 of the Custom Act 1967

    "To comply with the provisions of this legislation for passengers arriving in Malaysia by air, RMCD requests the cooperation of all airlines entering Malaysia to make announcements to all passengers on the requirement to fill up Form K7 and to submit it to the duty officer of Customs at the airport," he said

    CAAM has even provided a sample announcement to be made on the flight before the plane lands in Malaysia, both in English and Malay

    "The declaration shall be made by using Customs Form No

    7 is available at the RMCD counter

    "Any false declarations or failure to declare is an offence under Malaysian law." On the decision, Voo said that every passenger or other person arriving in or leaving Malaysia shall declare all dutiable or prohibited goods in his possession, either on his person or in any baggage or in any vehicle, to the proper officer of Customs

    55 of the Customs Regulation 2019, every traveller or other person arriving in or leaving Malaysia shall declare in Form Customs No.7 in the Third Schedule," he said in a statement on Tuesday (Oct 4)

  • UNFAIR MATRICULATION AND UNIVERSITY ADMISSIONS: FROM REACTION TO SOLUTION — LEE HWOK AUN

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/what-you-think/2022/10/07/unfair-matriculation-and-university-admissions-from-reaction-to-solution-lee-hwok-aun/32212

    10/07/2022

    78.43% Shortened!

    Calls for the non-Bumiputera matriculation quota to be increased from 10 per cent may echo, now and then

    First, we must broaden the definition of who ‘deserves’ to get admission or scholarships

    It is difficult to deny that they should be given a chance to pursue their education programme of choice

    We also reduce academic ability to exam results

    Does higher education open enough space for them? Second, we need to go beyond demanding more non-Bumiputera spaces in matriculation colleges

    However, while a larger non-Bumiputera quota in matriculation (currently 10%) seems a morally appealing and pragmatic solution, this will cause a rush of already high-scoring Chinese and Indian students into this easier pre-university programme, and exacerbate inequalities within the community by compounding the disadvantage of those who miss out on the matriculation spots

    Would those who object to preferential treatment for Bumiputeras also object to preferential treatment for Orang Asli university applicants? The solution is not to sweepingly abolish ethnicity-conscious admissions, but to strike a balance of academic, socioeconomic and student diversity considerations

    So, how can Malaysia do better? First, matriculation and STPM must be revamped — basically made more rigorous, with a focus on equipping students for higher education instead of providing an easier pathway to university

    System-wide change, including the prospect of a single university entrance examination, is not feasible until we narrow the quality gap in the parallel university entry programmes

    Admission to university is surely too important to be left to a computer algorithm

    A further round of selection can be formulated to balance out student diversity — not just by ethnicity, but also region, language, and other aspects

    ['high', 'student', 'admission', 'university', 'matriculation']

    Calls for the non-Bumiputera matriculation quota to be increased from 10 per cent may echo, now and then

    First, we must broaden the definition of who ‘deserves’ to get admission or scholarships

    It is difficult to deny that they should be given a chance to pursue their education programme of choice

    We also reduce academic ability to exam results

    Does higher education open enough space for them? Second, we need to go beyond demanding more non-Bumiputera spaces in matriculation colleges

    However, while a larger non-Bumiputera quota in matriculation (currently 10%) seems a morally appealing and pragmatic solution, this will cause a rush of already high-scoring Chinese and Indian students into this easier pre-university programme, and exacerbate inequalities within the community by compounding the disadvantage of those who miss out on the matriculation spots

    Would those who object to preferential treatment for Bumiputeras also object to preferential treatment for Orang Asli university applicants? The solution is not to sweepingly abolish ethnicity-conscious admissions, but to strike a balance of academic, socioeconomic and student diversity considerations

    So, how can Malaysia do better? First, matriculation and STPM must be revamped — basically made more rigorous, with a focus on equipping students for higher education instead of providing an easier pathway to university

    System-wide change, including the prospect of a single university entrance examination, is not feasible until we narrow the quality gap in the parallel university entry programmes

    Admission to university is surely too important to be left to a computer algorithm

    A further round of selection can be formulated to balance out student diversity — not just by ethnicity, but also region, language, and other aspects

    ['high', 'student', 'admission', 'university', 'matriculation']



  • TI11 POWER RANKINGS: PSG.LGD, TEAM SPIRIT, AND OG ARE STILL THE BEST

    https://www.oneesports.gg/dota2/ti11-power-rankings/

    10/07/2022, 12:05

    91.06% Shortened!

    The roster’s only appearance at LAN this year was at the PGL Arlington Major, where they had the dubious honor of being the last team in the group stage, because there were only 17 teams

    But in that very tournament, they were also the only team to take a game off PSG.LGD in the group stage

    But the team has slowly assembled their team, piece by piece

    Every team at TI11 can be a potential hurdle

    That said, this team is just one person removed from the team that finished second in both Majors in 2021

    So why does the North American team remain a force to watch out for? At their best, the team has shown themselves to be a team chock-full of individual talent

    The team achieved silver at Stockholm Major in a run that felt less miraculous and more like they understood the meta intimately — a good sign for a team able to evolve with the tournament

    The team’s unpredictability with their strategies and heroes are invaluable

    Team Aster seems like they’ve finally — finally! — figured it out

    ESL One Malaysia 2022

    The Chinese team has been the bastion of consistency for years now, no matter the roster

  • MALAYSIA AMONG 11 NATIONS THAT ABSTAINED FROM UN VOTE ON DEBATE ABOUT CHINA'S TREATMENT OF UYGHUR MUSLIMS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2022/10/07/malaysia-among-11-nations-that-abstained-from-un-vote-on-debate-about-chinas-treatment-of-uyghur-muslims/32202

    10/07/2022, 11:33

    56.0% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise GENEVA, Oct 7 — The UN Human Rights Council on Thursday voted against debating alleged widespread abuses in China’s Xinjiang region after intense lobbying by Beijing, in a heavy setback for Western nations

    The United States and allies last month brought a draft decision targeting China to the UN’s top rights body, seeking as a bare minimum a discussion on Xinjiang

    The move came after former UN rights chief Michelle Bachelet released her long-delayed Xinjiang report, citing possible crimes against humanity against Uyghurs and other Muslim minorities in the far-western region

    But in a moment of knife-edge drama, countries on the 47-member council in Geneva voted 19-17 against holding a debate on human rights in Xinjiang, with 11 nations abstaining

    Amnesty International branded the vote farcical, while Human Rights Watch (HRW) said it betrayed abuse victims

    “The United States condemns today’s vote preventing a discussion about Xinjiang,” US ambassador to the council Michele Taylor tweeted

    Washington and some Western countries have used Xinjiang “to spread rumours and cause trouble, engaging in political manipulation under the guise of human rights, attempting to smear China’s image,” a Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson said in a statement

    One Western diplomat stressed that regardless of the outcome, “the number one objective has been fulfilled” in putting Xinjiang in the spotlight

    Amnesty secretary general Agnes Callamard said Thursday’s vote put the council in “the farcical position of ignoring the findings of the UN’s own human rights office”

    “For council member states to vote against even discussing a situation where the UN itself says crimes against humanity may have occurred makes a mockery of everything the Human Rights Council is supposed to stand for.” HRW’s China director Sophie Richardson called it an “abdication of responsibility and a betrayal of Uyghur victims”

    China launched an all-out offensive to dismiss Bachelet’s report

    ['human', 'right', 'vote', 'china', 'xinjiang']

    About Us Advertise GENEVA, Oct 7 — The UN Human Rights Council on Thursday voted against debating alleged widespread abuses in China’s Xinjiang region after intense lobbying by Beijing, in a heavy setback for Western nations

    The United States and allies last month brought a draft decision targeting China to the UN’s top rights body, seeking as a bare minimum a discussion on Xinjiang

    The move came after former UN rights chief Michelle Bachelet released her long-delayed Xinjiang report, citing possible crimes against humanity against Uyghurs and other Muslim minorities in the far-western region

    But in a moment of knife-edge drama, countries on the 47-member council in Geneva voted 19-17 against holding a debate on human rights in Xinjiang, with 11 nations abstaining

    One Western diplomat stressed that regardless of the outcome, “the number one objective has been fulfilled” in putting Xinjiang in the spotlight

    China launched an all-out offensive to dismiss Bachelet’s report

    ['human', 'right', 'vote', 'china', 'xinjiang']
